Pedro de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta 5° grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar. Tiene 4 hijos, 3 viven con ellos de los cuales 1 trabaja y dos estudian 7° y 5° grado, además tiene un nieto a su cargo.

Por el momento, Pedro trabaja de vigilante en una granja avícola, lo ha hecho desde hace 5 años y realiza trabajos de agricultura porque siembra maíz en un terreno cerca de su casa, su hijo mayor lo apoya en dichas labores. Para irse al trabajo, Pedro lo hace en bicicleta y tarda 20 minutos en llegar. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar bloques, cemento, arena y pagará la mano de obra para construir una pared en su vivienda y sentirse más seguro, 

Su sueño es seguir trabajando para mantener el hogar y que sus hijos sigan el camino del bien para que se preparen, también desea mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Pedro is 54 years old and left school after the fifth grade. He has a partner who is a housewife. He has four children, three of whom live with them. One of these three works and the other two study in the seventh and fifth grade. He also looks after one of his grandchildren.

At the moment, Pedro works as a security guard on a poultry farm. He has had this job for five years and also works in agriculture, growing maize on a plot of land near his home. His eldest son supports him in this work. Pedro makes the 0-minute journey to and from work on his bicycle.

Pedro needs the loan to buy blocks, cement and sand, and to pay for labourers to build a wall in his home so that he feels safer.

His dream is to continue working to support his household and so that his children can continue along the right path to become successful adults. He also wants to make home improvements.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement and sand, and to pay for labourers to build a wall in his home so that he feels safer.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 24-year-old married man from Yatta, a village near Hebron city. 

Four years ago, he started his own business, which is buying used furniture and reselling it after make repairs and maintenance. It is a very good business and provides the family with a good income.

Thaer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new machines he needs in his workshop. By taking this loan, Thaer will be able to produce better quality furniture when he renews it.

loans.use: to buy new machines he needs in his workshop.

loans.name: Vilma Yolanda

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 53 años de edad, estudió en la escuela de la comunidad hasta 3° grado, ahora está casada y su esposo tiene un negocio de ropa deportiva, solo un hijo vive con ella pero está acompañado y también él se involucra en el negocio de su padre. 

Vila tiene una tienda de productos básicos en su casa, además tiene un negocio el cual es por temporadas, ella vende ropa femenina. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar ropa como camisas, pantalones, ropa interior y revenderla. 

Ella planea hacer más grande su negocio y que sea el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma, aged 53, studied in the community school until third grade. She is now married and her husband owns a sports clothing company. Only one of her children lives with her, but he is in a relationship and is also involved in his father's business.

Vilma has a store selling basic staple goods in her home, she also has a seasonal business selling women's clothing.

She needs this loan to buy clothing, such as shirts, trousers and underwear to sell.

She plans to expand her business, and for it to support her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, such as shirts, trousers and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis janvier 2011,il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le commerce.

Aissatou qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est veuve et âgée de 59 ans et mére de 07 enfants dont 03 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de légumes et de fruits, qu'elle pratique depuis de longues années.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 02 sacs de choux à 15000f le sac,03 sacs d'oignons à 7000f le sac et 03 sacs de pomme de terre à 8000f le sac.

Son objectif est de participer aux charges liées à la nourriture et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in January 2011 and is made up of women living in the same village who work in trade.

Aissatou, who is on the right in the photo with her arm raised, is the leader of the group. She is a 59 year old widow with seven children of whom three girls.

Her activity is selling vegetables and fruit. She has been doing this for many years.

With her loan, she plans to buy two sacks of cabbages at 15,000f the sack, three sacks of onions at 7000f the sack and three sacks of potatoes at 8000f  the sack.

Her aim is to contribute to expenses for food and to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anexo Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANEXO HUAYNA POTOSI” iniciará el vigésimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maribel es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de moldes de sombreros, venta de polleras, tienda de barrio, venta de polleras, venta de carne y abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de turriles. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maribel es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de turriles; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, aprendiendo de sus padres quienes trabajaban con este productos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de turriles por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá a las ferreterías. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras en la institución.

En la imagen están ausentes dos clientes, las mismas se fueron porque tenía que recibir una mercadería importante; ademas acompaña al grupo la asesora de crédito, la misma esta vestida con una chaqueta negra y el esposo de una de las clientas, él esta con una gorra amarilla.
texts.en:
The “ANEXO HUAYNA POTOSI” group is about to begin its 28th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Alto Lima. It has ten members and is led by a board of directors, on which Maribel is the secretary. The members of the group run a variety of businesses including: selling blankets, selling hat blocks, selling skirts, running a grocery shop, selling skirts, selling meat and groceries, selling food and selling barrels. 

The loan will help small micro entrepreneurs, including Maribel. She says that she has joined Pro Mujer for the first time, at the invitation of a promoter from the institution who came to visit her in her home. She currently sells barrels for a living; she says that she set up the business a few years ago, learning her trade from her parents who worked in the same area. 
She will use the loan to boost her capital so that she can buy barrels in bulk from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and she will then sell them to hardware shops. This type of work enables her to generate the income she needs to support her family, as she is a single mother..  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes being with her colleagues in the institution. 

Two clients are missing from the photo because they had to leave to take delivery of some important merchandise. Additionally, the credit assessor is also in the photo (she is the one wearing the black jacket) along with the husband of one of the clients (he is the one wearing a yellow cap).

loans.use: to buy barrels in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale materials for making umbrellas of all kinds

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado, tiene una hija, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Pedro, trabaja en la carpintería, también dedica tiempo a trabajar en la agricultura desde hace más de diez años; estas actividades las aprendió de su papá, el cual se las enseño con la intención de que cuando fuera adulto, él fuera un hombre productivo y así ha sido gracias a su padre.

El taller de carpintería lo tiene en su casa, él no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo, ya que trabaja por la mañana y a veces lo hace de noche.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar madera, pegamento y clavos para seguir trabajando, también  invertirá parte del crédito en la reparación de su vivienda.- El espera  que el negocio crezca y así poder comprar más maquinaria, para poder trabajar mejor y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes  y obtener mejores ingresos, para el bienestar de su familia.

Sus sueños son, que su hija estudie y que aproveche la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Pedro is 42 years old and left school after the fourth grade. He has a partner, who looks after their home, and a daughter.

Pedro works as a carpenter. He has also worked in agriculture for over ten years. He learned these activities from his father, who taught him them so that when he became an adult he would be a productive person. Thanks to his father, this has turned out to be the case.

Pedro's carpentry workshop is in his home. He doesn't have fixed hours, but works in the morning and sometimes at night.

He needs the loan to buy wood, glue and nails to continue working. He will also invest part of the loan in repairing his home. He hopes that his business will grow so that he can buy more tools, improve his work, and in this way satisfy his customers' needs and make more money for his family's wellbeing.

His dream is for his daughter to study and make the most of the opportunity to study.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue and nails.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish and seafood and thus take advantage of the season in which you get the best price; also to make an adjustment to his motorcycle.

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 42 años de edad, no estudio, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, su esposo tiene 19 años de trabajar con una cooperativa de cafetaleros.

Juana, ha aprendido un poco a leer y escribir, gracias a sus hijos, pero actualmente, está asistiendo a clases para mayores, que imparten los jóvenes de su comunidad.- Ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar, pero anteriormente trabajo en un vivero, de café, pero por una plaga que llego al cultivo, las personas han dejado de sembrar y eso ha hecho que la cooperativa deje de hacerlo, pues les a ocasionado pérdidas, debido a  que no han podido vender todo lo que cultivaron.- Por ese motivo, ya no trabaja en ese lugar.- Ahora su esposo trabaja en el mantenimiento de un centro turístico.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para cambiarle la madera y algunas laminas del techo de la casa donde ella vive, la cual considera esta muy deteriorado.

Ella desea que alguna institución le ayude a realizarse unos exámenes médicos en la cabeza ya que padece de una enfermedad que desconoce y no cuenta con los recursos económicos para examinarse.
texts.en:
Juana is 42 years old, never studied, is married and has five children.  Her husband has been working for 19 years with a coffee cooperative.

Juana has learned to read and write a bit, thanks to her children, but is now attending classes for seniors, that are given by the youth of the community.  She dedicates herself to the chores of the home, but previously she worked in a coffee nursery.  Because of a plague that came to the crop, the people have stopped growing and this made the cooperative quit because it caused them losses due to the fact that they were not able to sell all they had cultivated.  For this reason, she no longer works in this place.  Now her husband works in maintenance at a tourist center.

The money from the loan she needs to change the wood and some roof sheeting on the home in which she lives. She considers her home to be very deteriorated.

She hopes that some institution will help her to get a medical exam on her head because she suffers from a sickness she does not know anything about and she did not have the financial resources to get an exam.

loans.use: to change the wood and some roof sheeting on her house.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es:
Ada, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, no continuo estudiando, debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos, está casada y su esposo trabaja en una moto-taxi, prestando servicio de transporte de pasajeros hacia el pueblo más cercano, mientras que ella tiene 14 años de dedicarse a la costura, elaborando camisas, faldas, pantalones, etc.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar tela, hilo, botones, zíperes, broches, para la elaboración de la ropa.

Ella sueña con aprender a hacer vestidos para boda y de quince años, ya que debe de ser hermoso terminarlos y verlos, pues son para celebrar éxito y reflejan felicidad en las personas.
texts.en:
Ada is 37 years old and left school after the fifth grade. She was unable to continue her studies as her parents were too poor. She is married and her husband works providing transport services for passengers to nearby towns with his motorbike taxi. She has worked as a dressmaker for 14 years, creating shirts, skirts, trousers, etc.

Ada needs the loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zips and fasteners to make clothing.

Her dream is to learn how to make wedding dresses and dresses for girls celebrating their 15th birthdays, an important milestone in El Salvador. She thinks it must be a beautiful feeling to finish them and see how they look, since they are used to celebrate success and reflect peoples' happiness.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zips and fasteners to make clothing.

loans.name: Lea Johanna

texts.es:
Lea de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y cuida ganado bovino, actualmente Lea tiene 3 meses de embarazo. 

Ella se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de ganado junto con su pareja, esto lo aprendió ella de sus padres que se dedicaban a esta actividad, cultiva en el terreno de su papá y los insumos los compra en la ciudad, además en ocasiones compra y destaza cerdos. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una vaca para repasto, para ponerse en control prenatal y también debe llevar a su suegra a pasar una consulta médica. Esto le asegura a Lea la estabilidad personal y seguridad durante su embarazo y tendrá la posibilidad de vender la vaca a un mejor precio.

Ella sueña con tener seguridad económica, piensa algún día construir su casa aparte para vivir solo con su esposo y su hijo.
texts.en:
Lea is 23 years old and left school after the sixth grade. She has a partner who works in agriculture and looks after cattle. Lea is currently three months' pregnant.

Lea makes a living in agriculture and raising livestock alongside her partner. She learned these activities from her parents, who worked in them too. She works her father's plot of land and buys inputs in the city. She also sometimes buys and butchers pigs.

She needs the loan to buy a cow for her pasture, go to her antenatal check-ups  and take her mother-in-law to a medical appointment. This will ensure Lea's personal stability and security during her pregnancy and give her the chance to sell the cow on for a better price.

She dreams of having financial security. One day, she plans to build her own home so that she can live alone with her husband and their child.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her pasture, go to her antenatal check-ups  and take her mother-in-law to a medical appointment.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela, de 48 años de edad, no estudio, tiene 20 años de estar acompañada  y su compañero de vida trabaja en la alcaldía de su municipio, mientras que ella se ha dedicado a los quehaceres del hogar desde que se acompañó, aunque en ocasiones ha trabajado en un vivero de café en una cooperativa.

El crédito lo ocupará para pagar los gastos de graduación de su hija, ella es un orgullo para él y es un gran logro muy importante para su familia.

Graciela, sueña con que sus otros hijos continúen estudiando y que sean profesionales.- Además, desea arreglar su casa, ya que donde vive es de lámina.
texts.en:
48-year-old Graciela did not have an education. She has been married for 20 years. Her husband works in the Town Hall whilst, since their marriage, she has worked as a housewife. From time to time, however, she has worked in a coffee tree nursery in a cooperative.

She will use the loan to pay her daughter's school graduation fees. Graciela is extremely proud of her daughter and this is a big achievement for the family.

Graciela's dream is to see her other children continue their education and have professional careers. In addition, she would like to have repairs done to her home, as it is made from metal sheeting.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's graduation fees

loans.name: Nemer

texts.en:
Nemer is a 35-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and young kids. He works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. In the last violence on Gaza, his home was destroyed completely. 

Nemer took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy cement and stones for rebuilding his home. By taking this loan, Nemer will be able to move back with his family and live in their house.

Nemer appears in the photo in his destroyed house

loans.use: to buy cement and stones for rebuilding his home.

loans.name: Masoud

texts.en:
Masoud is a 35-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and kids. He works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. In the last violence on Gaza, his home was destroyed completely. 

Masoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy construction supplies to rebuild his home.  by taking this loan, Masoud will be able to move back with his family and live in their house.

Masoud appears in the photo in his destroyed house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to rebuild his home.

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ablaye s’active dans le domaine de l’élevage depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. C’est un client habitué du guichet, et vient solliciter ce crédit pour faire de l’embouche bovine. Avec cette somme de 300 000F, il va acheter deux ou trois veaux, les élever pour les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
Chaque matin, Ablaye amène ses bêtes paitre dans la brousse pour minimiser les dépenses prévues pour leur alimentation pour tout le cycle que dure l’embouche.
Les crédits pris à l’IMCEC ont eu un impact positif sur son activité, car ils lui ont permis de diversifier et de faire du stockage. Dans l’avenir, Ablaye veut renforcer son commerce en augmentant son capital.
texts.en:
Mr. Ablaye has worked in livestock farming for 10 years. He is married with children. He is a regular at the loan counter and requests this loan for bovine fattening. With this amount of 300,000F he will buy two or three calves and raise them for sale at the weekly markets.
Every morning, Ablaye takes his livestock to graze in the bush to minimise the costs for their fodder, right through the fattening period. The loans that he has obtained at the IMCEC have had a positive impact on his business, as they have enabled him to diversify and to make reserve storage. In the future, Ablaye hopes to strengthen his business by increasing his capital.

loans.use: to buy two or three calves, to fatten them and sell them.

loans.name: Cuestion De Fe Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CUESTION DE FE II” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de costura, venta de chinelas, venta de zapatos de cholita, venta de perfumes, venta de comida. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos de cholita; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al apoyar a sus tías, ya que ella comercializan el mismo producto y ella ayudo desde niña. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de zapatos de cholitas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Cuestion de Fe II" (Question of Faith II) begins its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional hub of Panamericana.  It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Margarita is the president.  The businesses carried out by the bank's members are varied; among them are a sewing workshop, the sale of slip-on shoes, the sale of traditional shoes for "cholitas" (Bolivia's indigenous women), the sale of perfume, and the sale of food.

The loan that they are getting will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs like Señora Margarita.  She points out that she has been a part of Pro Mujer for three years; she was invited by a friend who is a client of the institution.  At present, she has a business selling traditional shoes to cholitas. She started this business in order to support her aunts because they sell the same product and she has helped them since she was a little girl.

The loan that Margarita will now get is to increase her capital so she can buy wholesale shoes for cholitas, which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later sell in her own shop.  This type of work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family financially. Margarita is married and has five children.

When asked if she likes Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale shoes for "cholitas" (Bolivia's indigenous women).

loans.name: Celina Beatriz

texts.es:
Celina de  22 años de edad está acompañada, estudió hasta quinto grado de educación básica, aún no tiene hijos. 

Celina es cosmetóloga, antes de acompañarse trabajó seis meses en ese oficio y actualmente tiene una tienda, su compañero de vida es quien le ayuda en las compras de mercadería, la tienda la tiene desde hace 8 meses aproximadamente, surgió la iniciativa porque en el lugar donde reside no había una tienda cerca.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar ropa, zapatos, y granos básicos y aumentar el inventario de su tienda. 

Su sueño es seguir trabajando mucho y ver su tienda más grande y abastecida.
texts.en: Celina is 22 years old and is in a relationship. She studied up to Grade 5 and has no children yet. Celina is a cosmetologist. She worked in this job 6 months before she started her relationship and now she has a store. Her life companion is who helps her with the purchase of merchandise. She has had the store for about 8 months. She opened it because there is no store close to where she lives. The loan is needed to buy clothing, shoes and basic grains to augment the inventory of the store. Her dream is to continue to work hard and see her store become larger and well stocked.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and basic grains to increase the inventory in her store.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Kenneth, a very industrious, honest and hardworking man from the Kericho area of Kenya, near the famous Rift Valley escarpment. Kenneth, 24, has been farming for the past eight years. Through these years, he has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in his village. He has been practicing mixed farming. His primary sources of income has been milk, eggs, tea, crops and some small business ventures that help him make ends meet. 

Kenneth is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating his farm. That is why, every day, he wakes up very early to go to his farm to plow. Although he makes profits from farming, he is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase his income by selling cereals. That is why he is seeking this loan to buy cereals. 

Kenya's Kericho area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Kenneth could increase his profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Kenneth, but he now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring men farmers like him turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. 

Kenneth believes that this loan will be of much help, and that he will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. He also believes that the extra income he earns will enable permanent change in his life and expand his business. Increased profits will allow Kenneth to repay this loan and secure the future of his school-going siblings and ageing parents.

loans.use: To buy cereals to resell

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltero, no tiene hijos, pero si tiene su casa propia en el terreno de sus padres.

Edwin, anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero ahora trabaja en la zona urbana en proyectos y actividades que se presentan en la alcaldía, 

Para llegar a su lugar de trabajo Edwin, tiene que caminar una distancia de 15 kilómetros y su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 4:30 de la tarde.

Es por esa razón que está solicitando el crédito, para comprar una motocicleta para poder trasladarse hasta su trabajo y así no sacrificarse mucho caminando esas grandes distancias.

Su mayor sueño es, poder tener su hogar con su familia y poder darles lo mejor y lo necesario.
texts.en:
Edwin is 31 years old and studied until high school.  He is single, does not have any children, but has his own home on his parent's land.

Previously, Edwin dedicated himself to agriculture, but now he works in the urban zone in projects and activities presented by City Hall.

In order to get to work, Edwin has to walk a distance of 15 kilometers.  His schedule is from 8 in the morning until 4:30 in the afternoon.

It's for this reason he's requesting the loan, to buy a motorcycle to be able to transport himself to his job and this way not sacrifice so much walking these great distances.

His greatest dream is to be able to have a home with his family and be able to give them the best and the necessary.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mirna Patricia

texts.es:
Mirna es una mujer muy trabajadora de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera de dos hijos, de los cuales la muchacha está estudiando en la Universidad y trabaja en un salón de belleza, y el hijo mayor se encuentra viviendo con su padre en los Estados Unidos.

Mirna posee un pequeño salón de belleza en su casa y también tiene una pupusería que abre solo los fines de semana, cuando era mas joven trabajó en una oficina de agencias de viaje, posteriormente se casó y a los 21 años de edad emigró hacia los Estados Unidos, estando allá dio a luz a su primer hijo, luego de dos años regresó a El Salvador con su hijo y separada de su esposo, aquí dio a luz a su segunda hija, a los 25 años estudió cosmetología y trabajó en algunos salones de belleza. 
Hasta hace algunos  meses decidió traer el salón de belleza para su casa y así evitarse tener que viajar y pagar alquiler.


El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar cremas, tintes, navajas, entre otros materiales que son indispensables en su sala de belleza, también comprará una cocina para hacer pupusas pues la que tiene es muy pequeña y está muy deteriorada

Mirna sueña con sacar adelante a sus hijos para que se superen y lleguen a ser profesionales, también sueña con ampliar la pupusería para incrementar la clientela y generar mayores ingresos que le den una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirna is a very hardworking woman of 43 years of age.  She studied until high school, and is a single mom of two children.  Her daughter is studying in the University and works at a beauty salon and her older son is living with his father in the United States.

Mirna has a small beauty salon in her home and she also has a small "pupusería" (a shop that makes and sells tortillas) that is open only on the weekends.  When she was younger she worked at a travel agency office.  She later married and at 21 years of age immigrated to the United States.  There she gave birth to her first son and after two years returned to El Salvador with her son and separated from her husband.  Here she gave her birth to her daughter and at 25 years old she studied cosmetology and worked in some beauty salons.

It has been for some months that she has decided to bring the beauty salon to her home and this way avoid having to travel and pay rent.

The requested loan she needs to buy creams, dyes, razors, among other materials that are essential for a beauty salon.  She also will buy a stove to make corn tortillas because the stove she has is very small and deteriorated.

Mirna dreams of getting ahead so her children can overcome and become professionals.  She also dreams of expanding her "pupuseria" to increase her clientele and generate more revenues so that it gives them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, dyes, razors, among other materials that are essential for a beauty salon.  Also to buy a stove to make corn tortillas.

loans.name: Nelys Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelys de 63 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y se acompañó a los 22 años, tuvo cuatro hijos pero solo uno vive con ella y estudia, la pareja de Nelys es albañil. 

Nelys se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus hijos la apoyan económicamente y tiene una pensión de un hijo que falleció, como familia trabajan en agricultura como medio de subsistencia solo para consumo familiar, todos trabajan y luego se distribuyen la cosecha. 

El préstamo solicitado es para la construcción de un corredor en la casa de uno de sus hijos. 
Su sueño es mantener la unidad familiar y que sus hijos se esfuercen en tener sus casas cómodas para que los nietos estén seguros.
texts.en:
Nelys is 63 years old and never had the chance to study. She met her partner aged 22, and had four children. Only one of them lives with her and studies. Nelys' husband is a builder.

Nelys is a housewife. Her children support her financially and she receives an allowance for one of her children, who died. The family makes a living in agriculture, growing food for themselves. They all work and then divide the harvest among themselves.

Nelys is requesting a loan to to build a corridor in one of her children's homes. Her dream is to keep her family together and for her children to work hard to get comfortable homes so that her grandchildren are safe.

loans.use: to build a corridor in one of her children's homes.

loans.name: Jose Sabas

texts.es:
José, de 44 años de edad, no tiene ningún nivel académico al igual que su esposa, tiene un hijo de diez años de edad que está estudiando segundo grado.

José, tiene una tienda en su casa, tiene varios años de tenerlo; la idea del negocio surgió para generar ingresos extras.- Además, se dedica a la agricultura.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para su tienda y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

El sueño de José es, poder ampliar y comercializar más productos y de esta manera sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 44 years old and like his wife, does not have any academic level.  He has a 10 year old son that is in the second grade.

Jose has a store in his home and it's been various years since he's had it.  The idea for his business sprung forth in order to generate more revenue.  He also dedicates himself to agriculture.

He needs the loan to buy more merchandise for his store to be able to satisfy the needs of his clients.

Jose's dream is to be able to expand and sell more products and by this, help his family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 31-year-old single man from a village near Tulkarem city. He works as a construction worker in workshops inside and outside the city. it is a very hard business and the income is not high. Mahmoud decided to open a store selling home appliances.

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to prepare the new store and buy shelves to open his home appliances store. this will help him to improve his living conditions and be more independent.

Mahmoud appears in the photo in his new store.

loans.use: to prepare his new store and buy shelves to open a home appliances store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Doa

texts.en:
Doa is a 22-year-old single young lady from Gaza city. Her father works as an employee with a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Doa is a university student. She studies arts. She wants to complete her studies and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses.

Doa took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Doa will be able to read more articles online and do her homework.

Doa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Moneer

texts.en:
Moneer is a 26-year-old single young man from Ramallah city. He works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. He is also a university student. He studies Information Systems. He wants to complete his studies and find a better job to help his family with part of their expenses.

Moneer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Moneer will be able to complete his studies faster and improve himself.

Moneer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
Hamzah is a 22-year-old single young man from a village near the city of Nablus, in Palestine.  His brother works as a teacher in the public sector with low income, and Hamzah is a university student studying English literature.  He wants to complete his studies and find a job so that he may help his family with part of their expenses.

Hamzah has taken a USD loan from FATEN that will help him pay the university installments for this semester.  By taking this loan, Hamzah will be able to complete his studies faster and improve himself.  Hamzah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 21-year-old single young lady from the city of Nablus, in Palestine.  Her father works as an employee with low income and this is the only source of income to the family.  Lubna is a university student studying Economics.  She wants to complete her studies and find a job so that she may help her family pay part of their expenses.

Lubna took a USD loan from FATEN that will help her pay the university installments for this semester.  By taking this loan, Lubna will be able to complete her studies faster and improve herself.  Lubna appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables and root crops business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables and root crops to sell.

Norma has been in this business for 25 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables and root crops to sell for her business

loans.name: Romelita

texts.en:
Romelita is a 45-year-old married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fertilized duck egg business in the Philippines. 

Romelita requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional duck eggs to sell.

Romelita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Romelita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional duck eggs to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 41 years old and married with one child.  She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines.   Rosita has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Rosita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc. Previously Rosita has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Rosita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 54 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, se acompañó muy joven y tuvo dos hijos del primer hogar, falleció su compañero de vida y luego se casó otra vez y tuvo dos hijos más, sus dos últimos hijos se encuentran estudiando, y los mayores viven aparte pues ya se casaron…
María se dedica a los oficios domésticos pero en época de lluvia en el país se dedica a la agricultura como medio de subsistencia, actividad en la que se involucra toda la familia
El préstamo solicitado es para la reparación del área de cocina en su casa y para pagar el arrendamiento del terreno donde cultiva, esto le dará seguridad a María ya que la cocina actual se está cayendo, y asegurará el lugar donde sembrará próximamente.
Su sueño es hacer mejoras en la cocina de la casa, y piensa ampliar la vivienda y dar la oportunidad a los hijos que estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old. She never had the chance to study. She met her partner at an early age and had two children with him. Her partner died, and she remarried and had two more children. Her youngest two are studying, and the eldest two now live in thir own homes as they are already married.

María looks after the home, but during the rainy season she makes a living in agriculture as a means of subsistence, an activity in which the whole family is involved

She is requesting a loan to repair the kitchen area of her home and pay to lease the land she cultivates. This will provide María with security, as the current kitchen is falling apart, and she will be able to secure the next plot of land she will grow crops on.

Her dream is to make improvements to her kitchen, and she also plans to extend the home and give her children the opportunity to study so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to repair the kitchen area in her home and pay to lease the land she cultivates.

loans.name: Buenas Vecinas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BUENAS VECINAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Noeny es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejidos de chompas, venta de comida, venta de zapatos, venta de salchipapa, servicio de transporte, venta de verduras, viajera con productos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Noemy es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una prima que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de material de limpieza; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, conjuntamente su madre decidieron comercializar este producto a nivel interdepartamental. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material de limpieza por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Perú - Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Buenas Vecinas" (Good Neighbors) begins its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional hub of Panamericana.  It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Señora Noemy is the president.  The businesses that the members carry out are varied; among them are the knitting of sweaters, the sale of food, the sale of shoes, the sale of sausage, a transportation service, the sale of vegetables, and door-to-door sales.

The loan that they are getting will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs like Señora Noemy.  She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year; she joined at the invitation of a cousin who is a client of the institution.  At present, she has a business selling cleaning supplies. She started this business several years ago, and together with her mother they decided to sell these products at an interdepartmental level.

The loan that she will now get is to increase her capital so she can buy wholesale cleaning supplies, which she will get from the wholesalers along the Perú-Bolivia border and later sell in the city of Cochabamba.  This type of work allows her to generate resources so that she can support her family financially, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has one son.

When asked if she likes Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 25-year-old single young man from a village near Bethlehem city. He works in a restaurant where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Nader is also a university student. He studies press. He wants to complete his studies and find a better job.

Nader took  a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Nader will be able to complete his studies faster and improve himself.

Nader appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 34-year-old married woman with six children, 4 of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Marivic has requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Marivic has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other required materials

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркул, 54 года, замужем, многодетная мама 8 детей. У Анаркул среднее образование. В 1997 году она стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, купив для начала 2 коров. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркул на сегодняшний день у нее есть овцы, 3 дойные коровы и 3 лошади. Ежемесячная прибыль в основном от продажи молока, составляет до 60,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров мясо-молочного направления и корма для скота. Анаркул планирует расширить ее бизнес и накопить средства на покупку жилья для ее детей.
texts.en: Anarkul is 54, married, and has a large family with eight children. She has a secondary education and began raising livestock and planting crops in 1997, when she purchased two cows. Thanks to her hard work, Anarkul currently has sheep, three dairy cows, and three horses. She earns around 60,000 som (KGS) per month, mainly through milk sales. In order to expand her business, she applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy feed for the livestock and more cows for dairy and meat. Anarkul plans to expand her business and save money to buy property for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to increase her herds

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 53 years old and married with three children.  She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines.

Melinda has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Melinda has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Melinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Menirva

texts.en:
Menirva is a 23-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Menirva has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Menirva has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Menirva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Griseyda Marilin

texts.es:
Griseyda, de 33 años de edad, solamente estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltera  y sin hijos, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos.

Griseyda, se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, desde hace tres años, los ingresos que obtienen de la venta de tortillas, los necesita para poder ayudar económicamente a sus padres, decidió dedicarse a este negocio ya que no encontraba un empleo estable, fue por esa razón que tuvo que dejar de estudiar para poder tener su negocio y trabajar por el bienestar de su familia.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una plancha, para poder ampliar su negocio y poder dar atención a muchos clientes más.

Ella sueña con que su negocio crezca; también sueña con que su hermano siga estudiando y que sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Griseyda is 33 years old. Griseyda only studied up until the ninth grade, she is single, has no children, and lives with her parents and siblings. 

Griseyda has been making a living making tortillas for the last three years. The income she makes from selling tortillas helps her parents financially. Griseyda started this business after she struggled to find stable work. Due to the need to support her family and start making money, Griseyda had to dropp out of school.   

Griseyda needs the loan to buy a tortilla press. This will help to expand her business and to serve many more customers. Griseyda dreams of her business growing, she also dreams that her brother will be able to keep studying and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy a tortilla press

loans.name: Raef

texts.en:
Raef is a 44-year-old Palestinian refugee and a married father of four children. He has lived in a Palestinian camp since he was born. He started his own construction business in 2009 to provide his family with the necessary living needs and education.

Raef is a hardworking man, who puts so much effort into developing both his family's living and his business at the same time. He owns a winch which he uses to finish his requested projects.
  
Raef is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to make necessary maintenance to his house especially for the current winter season, since he is suffering from leaking, and moisture all over his house. He will also paste necessary tiles for his floor to keep his house in a healthy situation.

Raef is very anxious about his loan and he is looking forward to having the requested loans totally invested in his business development, which will lead to developing his family's social living.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to his house especially for the current winter season.

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en:
Alasgar is a 25-year-old man. He is married and has a son. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of their child. Alasgar earns money by raising and selling fruits and vegetables. His monthly profit is 170 AZN.

He likes gardening very much and became a gardener five years ago. Every day he pays more attention to his trees and vegetables. He sells his harvest in the fruit bazar. He always feeds, fertilizes and seeds in time. 

Alasgar awaits harvest time excitedly because his life depends on this harvest, but water problems make him unhappy. He needs to construct a way to provide water to his garden.

He applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: to construct a way to water to his garden.

loans.name: Uok

texts.en:
Uok is 48 years old and married with five children. She is an animal and rice farmer, who lives in Takeo province in Cambodia. For over 30 years, she has cultivated rice and fattened animals. Her husband is a 55-year-old construction foreman and now he is working in the city. Among the five children, two of them are working in a factory and three attend school. Together, they can make approximately $27 each day.

Uok is short of finances to buy lumber to build a house, so she would like to take out a loan. This loan will help her have enough finances to build a house, so she will be able to live in good conditions. For the children’s education, she will help them to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to  purchase additional household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Joyce, an ever-smiling 30-year-old. She is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Londiani, a remote village in Kericho. She is happily married and blessed with adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Kericho area is highly populated and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Joyce's biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to expand her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. For a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. 

Through this loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profits and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 49 years old and married with two children. Susana works very hard to provide for them.

Susana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Susana has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as coffee, milk, juice, canned goods, noodles, sanitary pads, etc.

Susana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana is a married woman with six children, two of whom are currently in school. She is 48 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vitaliana has a candle making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. Vitaliana requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her candle making business.

In the future, Vitaliana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her candle making business.

loans.name: Frenel

texts.en:
Frenel is 42 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines. 

Frenel has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc.   She has previously borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three months, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a hardworking middle-aged woman who lives in the Kericho area of Kenya. She is married to a lovely, diligent man who has given her adorable children. She has been doing dairy farming for a living for the last seven years. Her primary income source is milk. Rose has always wanted to do poultry farming as a business. She has a few birds that give eggs for food, but she feels it is time to upgrade to becoming a business. She is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase a brood of hens for egg production. She will be selling the eggs she collects to neighbors, institutions, hotels, and retail shops. Income from this business will help her deal with the high transportation costs that are eating into her profits. She will also use the increased income to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with three children, one of whom attends school while the others are still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business. Her potential customers are town dwellers and neighbors, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan of 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors waiting too long to repay her for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Amanda Daniela

texts.es: Daniela es una joven de 24 años de edad, vive con sus padres y hermanos, juntamente con su familia se dedican a sus pequeños negocios, Daniela se dedica a la venta de ropa en su mayoría ropa interior, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de lencería para luego ofrecerla a sus amigas y clientas, la aspiración de Daniela es mejorar su negocio y de ser posible ponerse un puesto de venta de ropa para así mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: Daniela is a 24 year old young woman, she lives with her parents and siblings. Together with her family she earns a living from small business. Daniela sells clothing, mainly underwear. She is going to use the loan to buy lingerie to sell to her friends and customers. Daniela's aspiration is to improve her business and if possible establish a clothing stall to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, por su situación económica no pudo seguir con sus estudios, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, tiene 2 hijas.

Sandra, se dedica a la venta de productos por medio de revistas, tiene tres años de tener este oficio, otra de las actividades que realiza es vender ropa y así generar ingresos extras.

Sandra, necesita el crédito para colocar una tienda, para poder empezar este negocio desde su casa y suplir sus necesidades diarias.

Sus sueño son, tener una mejor estabilidad alimenticia para su familia y sacar a sus hijas adelante.
texts.en:
Sandra is 31 years old, and left school after the eighth grade as her financial situation meant she was unable to continue with her studies. She has a partner who works in agriculture, and two daughters.

Sandra makes a living selling products through magazines, a job she has had for three years. She also sells clothing to make some extra money.

Sandra needs the loan to set up a store so that she can begin her business from her home and meet her daily needs.

Sonia's dreams are to achieve greater food stability for her family and support her daughters as they grow.

loans.use: to set up a store in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a small refrigerator for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials to finish his house.

loans.name: Tuweni Group

texts.en:
Esnat thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to purchase a bag of flour and cooking oil. This helped her to increase her business, and she now has more customers. She would like to get another loan in order to diversify her business, as she wants to starts selling beans since they are highly demanded in her area, and they also bring more profits.

She started her business to alleviate her household's level of poverty and send her children to better schools. She hopes to expand her business further and own a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to buy beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of sachet drinking water to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Fuente De Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FUENTE DE VIDA” iniciará el vigésimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de repuestos, venta de instrumentos de viento, venta de ropa, venta de mantas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de pizza. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace veinte años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa, ají y chuño (papa deshidratada); da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al apoyar a sus familia, ya que ella comercializan el mismo producto desde niña, con un capital adquirido en Pro Mujer decide independizar y emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa, chuño y ají por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera de Perú - Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Fuente de Vida” communal bank will begin its ninth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional hub.  It is made up of eight members and is lead by a Board of Directors, where Juana is president.  The businesses that the members carry out are varied; among them are: spare parts sales, wind instrument sales, clothing sales, blanket sales, a grocery store, and pizza sales.

The loan that they take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is Juana.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer twenty years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the organization.  She currently has a business selling potatoes, ají peppers, and chuño (dehydrated potatoes).  She says that she started this business to support her family because she has been selling the same products since she was a little girl.  With capital she got from Pro Mujer she decided to go out on her own and start her own business.

The loan she is now taking out is to increase her working capital (to buy potatoes, freeze-dried potatoes, and ají peppers in bulk).  She will get them from the wholesale merchants on the border of Peru and Bolivia, and she will later sell them in her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family financially, because she is married and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health care the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, freeze-dried potatoes and ají peppers in bulk

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha, 29, is a smallholder farmer based in Nyamira, a small rural town which is situated in the Nyanza region of Kenya. She has been doing this work for the last six years to provide for her family of four children. Her primary sources of income are milk and crops.

Tabitha enjoys farming a lot. Looking after her cattle, however, is quickly becoming a serious challenge. Her cattle stray from time to time from the designated grazing area into other people's farms. The consequences of this can be very severe, leading to disputes which can escalate to violence and hostility. Tabitha is seeking a loan to pay for fencing wire to fence her farmland.

The $25 dollar loan you make will enable Tabitha to have small paddocks created with the fences. It will allow her to make stocking more intensive. The paddocks will also be rotated to build up feed supply, which will also force the stock to graze a wider range of plants, and allow the plants to recover after grazing. The fence will also protect her crops from pests.

When asked how the loan would benefit her family, she replied, "Improves security in my compound, improves stock management, and keeps my neighbours happy."

loans.use: to fence her farm land.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Five years ago Tecla started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Ainamoi, a remote village in the Kericho area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have an improved time milking her cow and also feeding it. 

A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Tecla believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Tecla waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of eight children; seven of them attend school.

She offers tailoring services and supplements this with farming. She desires to expand and develop her business, despite the challenge of capital insufficiency.

She will use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is a married woman and has been blessed with two children both of whom attend school. For more than 10 years, she has sold fish, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. Mesaidi’s major business challenges are seasonality and perishability that can lead to loss. Together with her husband, she lives in a rented house with electricity and running water.  

Mesaidi is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of fish to resell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to sell

loans.name: Juan Andrés

texts.es:
Juan de 61 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta 5° grado, está casado y su esposa le ayuda en el trabajo agrícola ya que ellos producen papayas, tiene dos hijos que ya están acompañados. 

Juan es agricultor desde hace muchos años y también se desempeña como sastre desde hace 25 años, de modo que siempre se mantiene ocupado trabajando. 

Él necesita el crédito para comprar material para la sastrería y la agricultura (abono, venenos y semillas). 

Sus planes son que sus negocios crezcan para que su familia viva de una mejor manera.
texts.en: Juan is 61 years old, and has a fifth grade education.  He is married, and his wife helps him with the farm work since they produce papayas.  He has two children that are already in common-law relationships.  Juan has been a farmer for many years and has also worked as a tailor for twenty-five years, so he always keeps himself busy working.  He needs the loan to purchase materials for his tailor’s shop and farm (manure, weed killer, and seeds).  He plans to grow his businesses so that his family may live better.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his tailor’s shop and farm (manure, weed killer, and seeds).

loans.name: Nimaneno

texts.en:
Nimaneno is a widowed woman with one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours, pupils, and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Nimaneno dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of 35,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour and 10 kg of beans.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour and 10kg beans.

loans.name: Cristian Gabriel

texts.es: Cristian es un joven de 20 años de edad, se dedica a la comercialización de cuyes y de otros animales menores y comenta que sus padres son quienes le dan el ejemplo y de ahí aprende a hacer que es bueno este negocio, Cristian también trabaja en una mecánica y comenta que le pagan poco pero Cristian dice que trabaja para ganar experiencia, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para comercializarlos en las ferias o entregarlos por pedidos, Cristian aspira mejorar su negocio y salir adelante como un joven responsable.
texts.en:
Cristian is a 20-year-old young man.  He works selling guinea pigs and other small animals.  He says that his parents set an example for him and he learned from them that this was a good business.  Cristian also works in a mechanic shop.  He says that they pay him only a little, but he does the work in order to gain experience.  

He is going to invest this loan in the purchase of guinea pigs in order to sell them at fairs or deliver them to fulfill orders.  Cristian hopes to improve his business and get ahead as a responsible young man.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a divorced woman and has one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers go. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence leading to losses of perishable goods.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Cindy Marina

texts.es: Marina es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, Marina se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y también trabaja de vendedora de frutas en una frutería, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para comercializarlos en los mercados o para entregar pedidos que le hacen, ya que este negocio es en conjunto con su familia, la aspiración de Marina es mejorar su negocio para readecuar las cuyeras y seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en: Marina is a young 20 year old woman. She lives with her parents and siblings. Marina works raising small animals, and she also works selling fruit at a fruit store. She will use the loan to buy guinea pigs to sell at markets or to deliver for orders that she gets, since this is a business she has with her family. Marina's dream is to improve her business in order to readapt the stalls for the guinea pigs and move her business forward.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: María Elia

texts.es:
María de 32 años de edad, estudió hasta primaria, está acompañada y una de sus hijas está estudiando, también su mamá vive con ella. Su pareja se dedica al cultivo de maíz, además sabe el oficio de albañil, oficio que lleva desempeñando hace muchos años. 

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos, además realiza engorde de cerdos, y lo aprendió de un tío suyo.

 El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar ganado y cerdos para obtener mayores ganancias, pues ella compra los cerdos pequeños para engordarlos y luego venderlos a buen precio. 

Sus planes son comprar más ganado y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old, she studied to primary level, she has a partner and one of her daughters is at school, he mum also lives with her. Her partner grows corn, as well as knowing the building trade, a job he used to do many years ago. 

María looks after the house and family, she also fattens pigs which she learnt to do from an uncle.

She will use the loan to buy livestock and pigs to obtain better profits, as she buys small pigs to fatten and then sells them at a good price.

Her plans are to buy more livestock and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and pigs to obtain better profits, as she buys small pigs to fatten and then sells them at a good price.

loans.name: Ricardo Josael

texts.es:
Ricardo de 20 años de edad, es un joven que solo pudo estudiar hasta 9° grado debido a las dificultades económicas, está soltero y nadie depende de él. 

Él realiza trabajos de agricultura en cultivos tradicionales como maíz y frijol, esa es su forma de aportar a los gastos del hogar, desde pequeño a Ricardo le ha gustado la agricultura pero además realiza otros trabajos en obras de construcción cuando hay oportunidad. 

Ricardo necesita que le ayuden con este crédito para recoger la cosecha ya que tiene que pagar mano de obra que le ayuden y maquinaria, y con el préstamo solventará esta necesidad. 

Sus planes son seguir estudiando para tener más conocimientos y optar a un mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 20 years old, a young man who could only study until the 9th grade due to economic difficulties. He is single and has no dependants.

He works in agriculture with traditional crops like corn and beans, this is how he contributes to the household expenses. From a young age Ricardo has liked agriculture but he also does other jobs in construction when there is an opportunity.

Ricardo needs help from this loan to get in the harvest as he has to pay for labour to help him and for machinery, and with the loan he can meet these needs.

His plans are to continue studying to gain greater knowledge and choose a better job.

loans.use: to get in the harvest as he has to pay for labour to help him and for machinery.

loans.name: Jaime Saúl

texts.en:
Jaime is a Kubo Financiero client (this is his second loan with us) and this is his story:

Jaime is 39 years old and is single. He lives in a house he owns and has no economic dependents. He makes a living by selling typical food and products such as mole, cheese, meat and chocolate from the Mexican southern state of Oaxaca. He receives interested customers in his house and also owns a vehicle in which he can visit other clients.

Jaime asks for this loan to stock up his business, buy merchandise and be able to increase his sales and income.

loans.use: to stock up his regional food selling business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Las Cariñosas De Kalaque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CARIÑOSAS DE KALAQUE” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Herenia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, venta de chompas, venta de poleras, servicio de transporte, venta de leche y queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Herenia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de queso y pescado; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus padres, quienes comercializaban estos productos como negocio familiar, posteriormente ella decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de red) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de pesca. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella aún es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “LAS CARIÑOSAS DE KALAQUE” will begin their second cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Achacachi. The group is make up of 8 members and is headed by Ms. Herenia, the Secretary. The businesses that the members have are varied and range from selling fish to selling sweaters, selling shirts, running a transportation service and selling dairy products.

The loan today will benefit these small businesses. Herenia says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago after a large marketing campaign launched by the institution. Currently, she has a dairy and fish business. She says she learned the trade from her parents years ago. They sold these products together as a family business, but as an adult she decided to open her own business.

The credit will be used to help her purchase a new net that she will buy from the vendors in La Paz. She will later use the net to help her fishing business. This work helps her to earn enough money to financially support her family, which is especially important since she is still single.

When asked about Pro Mujer, Herenia says that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: purchase a net.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Hello! Meet David (pictured above with his small boy) from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. David is 40 years old and a proud father of angel-looking children whom he really adores and cherishes.

Other than doing some small business, David is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. He has gained so much experience through those years of farming. David practices mixed farming. That is, he grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities he has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion he has for farming, he has even nicknamed one of his cows. He really enjoys taking care of his cows.

Although David has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious man. His farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases.
