That is why he is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and expand his horticulture farm.

Through the loan, David will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, he will increase his profit margins. Through this loan, David will be able to expand his horticulture business.

He sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, David will make enough income to take care of his family and other farming expenses.

He wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give his family a decent living and afford his children proper education.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and expand his horticulture business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start an agro-veterinary shop

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Originally from the Dominican Republic, Alejandro has lived in the United States for twenty-three years. Nine years ago, he started an accounting business to provide help with taxes, accounting, and translations of important documents. He is an IRS registered tax preparer, and his business currently provides assistance in a variety of subjects, including income tax, licensing, insurance, and legal services for taxpayers and small businesses in New York City and surrounding areas.
	
The legal and accounting services provided by Alejandro enable many people to save both time and money, and he greatly enjoys providing this valuable service. 

With this loan, Alejandro will be able to replace his old computers and pay off various business expenses. This will allow him to increase the number of clients he can assist and provide services more efficiently. In the future, he plans to go to school to obtain his Master’s and potentially open a new office.

loans.use: to purchase new computers and pay off expenses for his accounting services company

loans.name: Latiffany

texts.en:
For many years, Latiffany was acutely aware of the shortage of affordable and stylish clothing for plus-sized women. Starting in 2012, she decided to address the need by starting an online site that sold fashionable clothing at economical prices. Since the launch of her online site, Latiffany has successfully organized the Ms. Kurvie NY Pageant and has seen an increase in customers. However, she has run into the problem of not having enough merchandise to supply the needs of her customers. She plans to expand her business to include a store, in addition to her website.

With this loan, Latiffany will be able to purchase more merchandise and supplies for her store. In the future, she hopes to open additional stores and find new ways to work as an advocate for female empowerment.

loans.use: to obtain merchandise to open a new KurvieKulture store for plus-sized women

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: A sus 34 años de edad Maria está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar  en una hacienda ganadera, el se dedica a sacar leche y también cuidad el ganado, Maria tiene  hijos, una de 14 años y su niño de 7 mismos que se encuentran estudiando, Maria vive en la casa de su madre y ahí es donde puede criar animales menores, con el dinero del crédito Maria va a comprar chanchos, la aspiración  de Maria es de trabajar duro junto a su esposo para comprarse un lotecito o para comprar una casita.
texts.en: Maria, 34, is married and her husband works at a cattle ranch; he is engaged in milking and also caring for the livestock.  Maria has two children, a 14 year old and a 7 year old son, and they are both in school.  She lives in her mother’s house where she raises small animals.  Maria will use the loan funds to purchase pigs.  Maria aspires to work hard with her husband, and purchase a little plot of land or a small house.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is 42 and married with five children, all attending school. She lives in Hoima, Uganda. Sylivia operates a retail shop where she mainly sells salt, sugar, bread, rice, and other items. She supplements her income by practicing agriculture. 

Sylivia is requesting a loan to buy more salt and sugar to sell. In the future, she desires to expand and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy salt and sugar to sell

loans.name: María Lilian

texts.es:
María de 58 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, está casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 viven en EEUU y 2 en El Salvador pero ya cada uno de ellos tiene sus familias por lo que en su casa solo vive María con su esposo. 

Anteriormente, María se dedicaba a la costura y también horneaba pan para salir a vender y aportar dinero extra a su familia, pero ahora debido a la edad solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

Ella necesita el crédito para construir un muro en la orilla de la calle para darle más seguridad a su vivienda. 
En un futuro ella piensa obtener un nuevo crédito para comprar un molino y poner ese servicio en su casa ya que considera que es muy rentable y productivo.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old. She went to school up to the 9th grade. She is married and has four children, two of whom live in the United States and another two who live in El Salvador, but each one has their own family and so Maria lives at home with just her husband.

Maria used to make a living as a seamstress and she also baked bread to sell and bring in some extra money for her family. Now, because of her age, she only takes care of the home.

She needs a loan in order to build a security wall between her home and the street.

In the future, she would like another loan in order to purchase a grinder she can set up in her home and start a grain grinding business that she thinks will be profitable.

loans.use: build a security wall for her home.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 33-year-old hardworking married man with four children. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. Peter runs a motorcycle (boda boda) business alongside a hotel and also earns a monthly salary. This enables him to look after his family. His greatest business challenge is the poor roads that sometimes lead to accidents.

Peter is requesting a loan to buy another motorcycle. In the future, he hopes to improve on his business to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nibia Mila

texts.es: Nibia tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera de sus 3 hijos dos mujeres  de 4  y 21 años de edad y un niño de 7 años que se encuentra estudiando,  Nibia se dedica a la venta de ropa,  al jornal y cuando puede también las tardes se dedica a vender comidas rápidas y es asi como saca adelante a sus hijos,  el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en ropa para ofrecerla puerta a puerta y lo que le gustaría es a futuro ponerse un local de ropa en una ciudad más grande donde  pueda vender mas y con sus ingresos que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en: Nibia, 38, is a single mother of three children, two daughters ages 4 and 21, and a 7 year old son who is in school.  Nibia is engaged in clothing sales, day labor, and also sells fast food when she can, and this is how she gets her children ahead.  She will invest the loan is clothing to sell door-to-door and in the future, she would like to set up a shop in a bigger city where she can sell more, and provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es:
Ana de 50 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación básica, es una mujer luchadora, ha tenido 2 esposos en su vida y los dos han fallecido de formas muy lamentables, vive junto con 3 de sus hijos, los cuales aún se encuentran estudiando, a excepción de una que recientemente salió del bachillerato y anda en búsqueda de adquirir un trabajo, también tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en los Estados Unidos.


Ana tiene un negocio de elaboración de tortillas en su casa, todos los días se levanta temprano para ir al molino y obtener la masa necesaria para hacer el producto, los clientes empiezan a llegar desde tempranas horas de la mañana, ella termina de trabajar aproximadamente de 2 a 3 de la tarde, además vende refrescos los cuales llegan a pedir  a su casa.


El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar suficiente maíz para hacer tortillas, pues a medida el verano avanza, este grano se pone más caro, además necesita también adquirir suficiente leña para tener como reserva y siempre pueda hacer fuego para hechar las tortillas.

El sueño de Ana es poder arreglar su casa, pues las paredes y el techo se encuentran bastante deteriorados y ella aspira a mejorarla, también sueña con que sus hijos lleguen a ser personas de bien y trabajadores que sirvan a su país y a sus familias.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old and attended school until third grade.  She is a determined woman. She has been married twice and both of her husbands have passed away under very sad circumstances. She lives with three of her children, two of whom are still in school. One of her children recently graduated from high school and is looking for a job, and three of her children live in the United States. 

Ana has a business where she makes tortillas in her home. She wakes up very early every day to go to the mill and purchase the corn flour that she needs to make her products. Her customers begin to arrive very early in the morning and she finishes work around 2:00 or 3:00 in the afternoon. She also sells beverages, which are delivered to her home.

She is requesting a loan to purchase enough corn to make tortillas. As summer arrives, corn will become more expensive. She also needs to purchase enough firewood so that she has a reserve and will always have enough to make a fire to make her tortillas.

Her dream is to be able to fix her home because the walls and roof are pretty deteriorated and she would like to improve them. She also dreams of her children becoming good people and hard workers who serve their country and their families.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and enough corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es:
Ramón de 31 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos van a la escuela y su pareja de vida trabaja en un comedor. 
Ramón es motorista de una empresa de encomiendas desde hace dos años, antes trabajaba en un taller como mecánico,  su horario de trabajo es de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm y viaja a distintos lugares del país. 
El préstamo lo utilizará para hacer reparaciones en su vivienda, sellar grietas, reparación de una pared y piso del baño, comprar pintura entre otros.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para darles educación a sus hijos hasta que logren graduarse.
texts.en:
Ramón, age 31, studied through high school.  He is in a relationship and has three children, two of whom go to school.  His partner works in an eatery.

For two years, Ramón has been a package delivery man on his motorcycle.  Before that, he worked in a shop as a mechanic.  His work schedule is 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., Monday through Saturday.  He travels to different places around the country.

He will use this loan to make repairs on his home: seal cracks, fix a wall and the floor of the bathroom, and buy paint, among others.

His dream is to keep working in order to give his children an education until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy paint, make repairs on his home, seal cracks, repair a wall, and fix the bathroom floor, among other things.

loans.name: Moises

texts.en:
Moises owns a few cows and dedicates himself to selling their milk. He has been looking for solutions to improve the cost-effectiveness on his farm, as he used to spend a significant amount of his income on LP gas and chemical fertilizers for his corn field. 

With his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Moises will be able to transform his cows' manure into methane-rich biogas connected to the cookstove and boiler in the house, as well as organic fertilizer to increase his corn's yield in a natural way. In addition to its economic benefits, the biodigester will also allow Moises to treat the waste instead of piling it up outside his farm, where it was contaminating underground water sources and emitting greenhouse gases. His farm will become more sustainable and self-sufficient, as Moises will take advantage of available and free resources, while displacing fossil fuel-based external inputs. 

With his savings, Moises plans to buy more cows and improve the infrastructure around his home and farm.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 16 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a hardworking man who is 40 years old. He is happily married with three children. Fred grew up in a very humble family that had few assets and was without school fees to educate him. To earn a living, he opted to work as a gardener. Due to his hard work, Fred managed to save some money and bought a piece of land in Bugashe, Nyakayojo, Mbarara District. He started a banana plantation which enabled him to earn enough income to be able to start constructing a home. 

Fred is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan to buy organic fertilizer to increase his yields and income.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for education costs.

loans.name: Mamasitas Ricas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAMASITAS RICAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vicenta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces y comida, venta de chamarras, venta de deportivos juveniles, taller de mecánica, venta de mantas, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vicenta es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace ocho años, para aprender del negocio inicio trabajando como vendedora, con un pequeño capital decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud  y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Mamasitas Ricas" communal bank is beginning its first loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes focal group. It is made up of 11 members and is run by a board of directors, of which Vicenta is the president. The members have various businesses like food and candy sales, jacket sales, children's sport clothing sales, mechanic shops, blanket sales, and vegetable sales. 

The loan will benefit small businesses like Vicenta's. This is the first time that Vicenta has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined after being invited by a large promotion run by the institution. She currently has a business where she sells blankets and has had this business for the past 8 years. In order to learn the business, she began working as a saleswoman. She started her own business with a small amount of capital.

She will use this loan to increase capital and purchase blankets in bulk. She will purchase the blankets from the bulk vendors in La Paz and later sell them at her store. Her job allows her to earn money to support her family because she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health focus and trainings that the institution provides.

loans.use: to purchase blankets in bulk.

loans.name: Viviana Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carmen cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Águilas Del Futuro, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Viviana, tiene 24  años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen una niña de tres años de edad. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Viviana junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos  tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí  venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también carnes, legumbres, frutas, artículos de bazar y papelería, helados entre otros productos, ellos ya llevan más de diez años con este negocio el cual les permite ganarse la vida honradamente, ella también todas las tardeas vende carne asada y chuzos acompañadas de plátano asado, el cual es del gusto de sus clientes que a diario visitan su local a realizar sus compras y degustan este rico alimento. 
Este crédito es para comprar: víveres para surtir su tienda, carne, plátano, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por el apoyo que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son seguir aumentado su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Aguilas del Futuro meets every fifteen days in the city of Carmen. The city is known for being dynamic and where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals since the area is very lush in vegetation.

This is where Viviana lives. She is 24 years old and she is in a relationship. She has a three year old daughter from this relationship. Her husband is a businessman.

Viviana also works with her husband and they sell groceries from their home. They sell all kinds of basic necessities as well as meats, vegetables, fruits, bazaar items and stationary, along with ice cream and more. They have run their business for more than 10 years and it has allowed them to live with dignity. Every afternoon they also sell carne asada and meat skewers that they serve with fried plantains. Their customers stop by every day to purchase groceries and enjoy the delicious food.

The loan will be used to purchase groceries to stock the store, meat, plantains and other items that they sell. They have been a part of their communal bank for 4 years and they are thankful for the support they receive. Their dream is to continue growing their business.

loans.use: purchase groceries, meat and plantains.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
A native of Camaguey, Cuba, Gladys has lived in the United States for thirty-two years. Seeking an opportunity to make money while setting her own hours, she originally started a business in floor restoration. Since then, her company has expanded from floor restoration to include a wide range of commercial cleaning services. She currently has eighteen employees, including her son and daughter.

Environmental sustainability is a responsibility her company takes seriously. By partnering with ECOLAB, they strive to purchase, sell, and use products with minimal cost to global ecosystems and resources.

Her greatest business achievement, she claims, is that through her entrepreneurship, she has been able to have financial independence. However, the business still holds a great deal of untapped potential.

With this loan, Gladys will be able to purchase more equipment and pay off business expenses, enabling her company to obtain more clients and get more floor restoration contracts.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be able to pay higher wages to her employees so that they, too, can become financially independent.

loans.use: to obtain more clients and contracts for her commercial cleaning and floor restoration company.

loans.name: Marci

texts.en:
Ever since she was a young girl, Marci had a passion for baking and cooking. She recalls from her memories of cooking with her dad that “he would always tell me stories of my grandmother cooking these wonderful meals, and I could see the love in his eyes as he thought back to those times. He still tells these stories today with the same feelings shining through.”

She has always dreamed of baking and cooking for a living, and hopes to make that dream a reality. After all, she firmly believes that preparing food is a wonderful way to make memories and demonstrate one’s love for others. Marci started her business in the summer of 2014, but is currently lacking the financial backing to get the business into production mode.

With this loan, she will obtain liability insurance, develop a website, and purchase packaging and shipping supplies. In the near future, she wants to see the business grow and eventually have her own storefront. This business venture has the potential to give her and her husband financial stability, and allow her to realize her long-term goal of earning a living doing the work she has always loved.

loans.use: to set up a website, obtain liability insurance, and purchase supplies for packaging and shipping of goods.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Since his teenage years, Andrei has loved performing flooring and remodeling work. Recently, he has observed an increase in demand for these services, and hopes to seize this opportunity to support himself with work he is passionate about.

Originally from the Republic of Moldova, Andrei currently works as an independent remodeling contractor, but now plans to open his own business and expand his services. He lives with his wife and two daughters, whom he hopes to send to college.

His loan will be used to pay for advertising, purchase tools, and cover assorted other expenses of the business. It will enable him to accelerate the process of obtaining clients for his new business.

In three years, he hopes to have a strong business reputation, with sustainable business revenue. With this money, he will enable his family to enjoy a higher quality of life and save for his daughters' college education.

loans.use: to pay for advertising, purchase important tools for his business, and obtain more clients for his flooring and remodeling business.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis has always had ties to cosmetology. His mother raised him and his brother through her work in this field, and he recently decided to open his own business. At New Light Spa and Salon, he works with his mother and one other employee.

He credits his mother with shaping his strong work ethic and drive to address the needs of his clients quickly and thoroughly. Owning his own business has allowed him to not only support himself, but also has also allowed him to get closer to his mother and support his brother through college.

Originally from Venezuela, he has lived in the United States for roughly twenty-two years, and currently lives with his mother and brother.

With this loan, he will be able to launch a publicity campaign and develop a website. He will also invest in new machinery and hire more employees to expand the number of services available for customers. This will allow him to bring on more clients, improve opportunities for his family, and allow his brother to continue his college education.

loans.use: to start a website and publicity campaign for his spa and salon, employ more staff, and invest in new machinery to expand services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to train new employees and increase inventory to provide better and more attractive services to customers in his hydrographics business.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.en:
Juan Pablo is a Mexican farmer who owns cows and sheep and cultivates corn on a field close to his house. He was very enthusiastic about the idea of taking advantage of his animals' manure to produce biogas and organic fertilizer, as it will allow him to displace the expensive and fossil fuel-based LP gas and chemical fertilizers he used to buy. With his biodigester, he will be able to treat the waste and transform it into productive resources, instead of considering it as waste and piling it up outside the farm, where it was contaminating underground water sources and emitting greenhouse gases. He will cook and heat water with biogas, while applying the nutrient-rich fertilizer on his corn field will nourish the soils and increase the crops' yield in a natural way. His overall quality of life will improve, as the manure will no longer attract flies or generate bad smells. He will have more money available to buy additional cows and improve the infrastructure on his farm.
This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 16 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Telmo Nery

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carmen cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Águilas Del Futuro, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive don Telmo, tiene 39  años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen una niña de 2 años de edad. Su esposa es comerciante.
El señor Telmo junto a su  esposa se dedican al comercio, ellos  tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también carnes, legumbres, frutas, artículos de bazar y papelería, helados entre otros productos, ellos ya llevan más de diez años con este negocio el cual les permite ganarse la vida honradamente,  él también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, porcino y aves de corral, mientras él se dedica a esta actividad es su mujer la que se queda a cargo del negocio, esto le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias que les permiten salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar: víveres para surtir su tienda y alimento para los animales. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the "Eagles of the Future" credit group meets in the city of Carmen. This place is known for being a very dynamic location where most of the residents work in agriculture and raise animals. It is also an area with great vegetation.

Telmo lives in Carmen and is 39 years old. He is in a common law marriage and has a 2-year-old daughter. His wife is a merchant. Telmo and his wife work in commerce and have a small store in their home. There, they sell many types of goods like meat, vegetables, fruit, housewares, stationery, ice cream, and other products. They have been doing this for the past 10 years and this has allowed them to earn an honorable living.

Telmo also raises cattle, pigs, and small birds. While he is working with the animals, his wife is in charge of the store. This way, they earn a good income while moving forward.

This loan will be used to purchase supplies to stock their store and food for the animals. He has been with the credit group for more than 4 years and likes it because the loans help him a lot. His dream is to provide the best for his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his grocery store and food for animals.

loans.name: Nancy Yadira

texts.es: Yadira esta casada, tiene 24 años de edad y sus 2 hijos tienen 1 y 5 años, el esposo de Yadira se dedica a la agricultura, Yadira se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y a trabajar al jornal, son 6 años que cría cuyes y comenta que si le va bien por este motivo necesita el crédito para  comprar cuyes y para adecuar sus cuyeras y asi  mejorar su negocio, la aspiración mas grande de Yadira es mejorar sus ingresos para comprarse un a casa ya que en la actualidad vive arrendando.
texts.en: Yadira, 24, is married and has two children, ages one and five.  Her husband is engaged in farming, and Yadira is engaged in raising small animals and in day labor.  She has been raising guinea pigs for six years and says that it is going well.  For this reason, she needs a loan to purchase guinea pigs and adapt their pens, and thus improve her business.  Yadira’s greatest aspiration is to increase her income and purchase a house since she is currently renting.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Martha Belgica

texts.es: Martha es una señora trabajadora, creció en el campo y la fuente de ingresos en su hogar es la ganadería y la agricultura, ella esta casada y tienen 5 hijos pero todos ya son independientes, ella se dedica desde que era muy joven a la ganadería, y es por medio de este negocio que le ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, el crédito o va a invertir en la compra de una vaca, lo que Martha aspira es seguir adelante en su negocio junto a su esposo y prepararse para su vejez.
texts.en:
Martha is a hardworking woman who grew up in the countryside. She makes a living by raising cattle and farming. She is married and has 5 adult children.

From a very young age, she has worked with cattle. Through this business, she has managed to move her children forward. She will use the loan to purchase a cow. 

Martha hopes to move forward with her business with her husband and prepare for old age.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a Kubo.financiero client and this is her story:

Rosa is 45 years old, single, and a mother of one. She is a grown-up woman who doesn’t economically depend on anyone. With some relatives, she lives in a house she owns, which was inherited from her parents. 

Rosa makes a living by working in an antojitos (typical Mexican food) stand, where she sells tacos, tortas, and such. 

She asks for this loan to make some repairs to her house. With the effort she puts into her house, she was able to support her house to be a woman of good. 

She aspires to open up her own stand in the near future.

loans.use: to make general repairs to her house.

loans.name: Gladace

texts.en: Gladace is 38 years old, is married with four children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She sells palm oil and has been in this business for 10 years. She has a dream of being the best in customer services. However, she is limited by a lack of capital. She wants a loan to buy palm oil for selling

loans.use: to buy palm oil for selling

loans.name: María Marta

texts.es:
María, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, esta casada y su esposo no tiene ningún nivel académico, él es agricultor, tiene 3 hijos.

Actualmente, su esposo no puede trabajar, debido a una incapacidad que él tiene, es por eso que María, se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, como también vende lociones y productos de revistas de belleza para dama y caballeros.- Esto lo realiza desde hace más de siete años, la idea de la venta y compra de cerdos fue de su esposo, ya que esta labor la puede desempeñar estando cerca de sus casa.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar más cerdos para destazar y comercializar la carne, de esa manera espera obtener ingresos suficientes para sus necesidades.

Uno de sus mayores sueños es, poder tener su propia crianza de cerdos para venderlos.
texts.en:
María, 47, studied up until the sixth grade. She is married and her husband does not have an academic education. He is a farmer. She has three children.

Currently, her husband cannot work due to a disability. Therefore, María buys and sells pigs and also sells lotions and beauty magazine products for women and men. She has been doing this for more than seven years. The idea of buying and selling pigs was her husband's, because she can do this work close to her house.

She needs this loan to buy more pigs to butcher and sell the meat. In this way, she hopes to obtain a sufficient income for her needs.

One of her greatest dreams is to be able to raise her own pigs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to butcher and sell the meat.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is young Mexican farmer who is very interested in solutions to save money by reducing his operational expenses, which mostly consist of LP gas and chemical fertilizer purchases. By using his cows' and sheep's manure as a resource and inputting it in his biodigester, he will be able to produce his own biogas and organic fertilizer. This will in turn allow him to displace the costly and unsustainable LP gas and chemical fertilizers, while improving his productivity, as he applies the nutrient-rich biofertilizer on his corn field. In addition to saving money, he will improve his carbon footprint by treating his animals' waste and making fossil fuels irrelevant for the operations on his farm. With the savings he makes, Juan plans to buy more cows, improve and diversify his family's diet and send his children to university.
This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa owns a few cows and earns a living by selling their milk. She decided to invest in a biodigester in order to reduce her expenses on LP gas, which were becoming a financial constraint for the operations on her farm. By inputting her cows' manure in the biodigester, Teresa will produce her own renewable energy (biogas) to cook and heat water in the house, as well as organic fertilizer she will apply on her corn field to increase her crops' yield in a natural way. In addition to displacing LP gas, Teresa will also eliminate chemical fertilizers, and she will not have to cook with wood anymore. Indeed, she used to inhale the toxic smoke on a daily basis, and her quality of life and health are bound to improve as she starts cooking in a smoke-free environment, using biogas. With the savings she makes, Teresa wants to build a roof for her cows' farmyard, and buy more cows to expand her milk production. She is looking forward to living in a cleaner, more sustainable and cost-effective farm.
This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
María de 35 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, está felizmente casada y su esposo se dedica a pintar muebles de madera y sus hijos aún se encuentran estudiando, viven todos juntos en su casa  y también vive su madre a la cual quiere pues se lo ha dado todo.

María se dedica a la satreria, profesión que aprendió desde los quince años de edad trabajando para otras personas en el centro de la ciudad, fue hasta que se casó cuando decidió independizase y trabajar para sí misma, actualmente llegan los clientes a su casa donde le hacen los pedidos, a veces son pedidos grandes pues también trabaja para algunas escuelas que le piden grandes cantidades de uniformes, cuando esto pasa María tiene que recurrir a la ayuda de dos muchachas a las cuales les paga.


El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar suficiente tela, zippers, botones, hilos y pelum para elaborar los uniformes que le encargan de las escuelas, y para reparar una máquina de coser.

Su sueño es ampliar el negocio, de manera que pueda llegar a tener más y mejores máquinas de costura y así tener empleadas que estén trabajando para ella, de esta manera cubrirá la demanda de los clientes y percibirá mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and is a hardworking woman. She attended school until sixth grade and is happily married. Her husband makes a living by painting wooden furniture and their children are in school. They all live together in their home and her mother, whom she loves very much, also lives with them.

María makes a living as a seamstress, a job that she learned when she was 15 years old and worked for other people in the center of the city. When she got married, she decided to become independent and work for herself. Now, her customers come to her home to place their orders. Sometimes, there are large orders, and she also works for some schools that order large quantities of uniforms. When this happens, María has to ask for help from two women, whom she pays to help.

She is requesting this loan to purchase enough thread, zippers, buttons, thread, and peplum to make school uniforms and also to repair her sewing machine. Her dream is to expand her business so that she can have more, better sewing machines and have more employees to work for her. This way, she will be able to satisfy her customers' demands and earn more money for her family.

loans.use: to purchase enough fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, and peplum to make school uniforms, and to repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel runs a small farm in Mexico, cultivating corn, kidney beans, and amaranth and also raising sheep. He sells half of his production at local markets while the rest is for his family's own consumption. By investing in his biodigester, he will be able to input his animals' manure into the biodigester, letting the bacteria transform it into an organic, nutrient-rich fertilizer. As he will start applying it on his fields, the yield of his plants will increase in a natural way, improving his productivity and allowing Angel to displace fossil fuel-based, costly chemical fertilizers. The methanization process taking place inside the biodigester also produces biogas, with which Angel's family will use to cook and heat water in the house, eliminating the need to buy expensive LP gas. As the manure will be treated, it will not contaminate underground water sources anymore, nor release greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. Angel will generate savings and have the financial capacity to expand his farm, while turning it into a more sustainable place to live and work.
This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to become more self-sufficient and protect the environment while saving money. He was very curious about the opportunity to transform what he used to consider as waste into a productive resource, allowing him to produce biogas and biofertilizer. As he inputs his animals' manure in the biodigester, he will be able to displace the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers from his farm. His wife will use biogas to cook, eliminating the need for wood, which was creating toxic smoke she was inhaling on a daily basis. The health and economic benefits resulting from the acquisition of a biodigester will drastically improve Israel's and his family's quality of life, as they will have more revenue available to expand their production capacity. Israel also cultivates amaranth and corn, on which he will apply the organic and nutrient-rich fertilizer, the second product of the biodigester leading to an improvement in the quality of his soil and stronger plants.
This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is pictured here on the day his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester was installed, a turning point in the operations of his farm. Indeed, he will now be able to input his animals' manure in the biodigester, thereby producing his own biogas and biofertilizer. This will significantly improve the cost-effectiveness of his daily activities, and might result in enough savings for him to leave his other job in a small mom-and-pop business. As he will auto-supply his farm in renewable energy and organic fertilizer, he will be able displace costly and unsustainable inputs such as LP gas and chemical fertilizers. Since the biogas will be directly connected to the boiler and cookstove, it will also become unnecessary to buy or collect wood for cooking, resulting in time savings and health benefits, since Erick's family members will no longer inhale toxic smoke while they cook. The manure will be treated by the bacteria inside the biodigester, instead of contaminating underground water sources and emitting greenhouse gases.
This loan represents 46% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.en:
Hermenegildo is a small dairy farmer. He owns a few cows and recently bought two piglets to diversify his sources of income. He produces the forage for his cows on a field close to his house. Before owning a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he used to pile his cows' untreated manure up outside the farm, where it was contaminating underground water sources, attracting flies, producing bad smells and emitting greenhouse gases. Meanwhile, his wife was cooking with wood she collected in the surroundings, inhaling the toxic smoke on a daily basis. Hermenegildo wanted to improve his quality of life, protect the environment and save money, which is why he invested in a biodigester. By inputting his cows' manure in his biodigester, he will produce his own biogas, which will be connected to the boiler and cookstove in the house, allowing his wife to cook in a clean, smoke-free environment and displacing the expensive LP gas. The biodigester also produces a nutrient-rich organic fertilizer, which will increase Hermenegildo's corn's yield in a natural way. Not only will he save money, but his direct environment will be healthier and more environment-friendly, resulting in a significant improvement in his and his family's living standards.
This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire a 16 m3 Sistema Biobolsa waste-to-energy system.

loans.name: Maurilio

texts.en:
Maurilio is a small dairy farmer; he owns a few cows, poultry, and cultivates corn he sells on the market and uses to feed his animals.

He was very enthusiastic about the idea to take advantage of his animals' manure to produce his own biogas and biofertilizer, as this will allow him to significantly reduce his operating costs, while protecting the environment. By inputting the manure into the biodigester, the natural methanisation process will produce methane-rich biogas, which will be directly connected to the cookstove and boiler in the house. The bacteria inside the biodigester will transform the remaining waste into a potent organic fertilizer for Maurilio's cornfield.

By treating and reusing his animals' waste, Maurilio will improve his carbon footprint, as greenhouse gas emissions will be reduced and underground water sources will be protected. His farm will be free of expensive fossil fuel-based inputs, and become a more sustainable place to live and work for Maurilio and his family.

This loan represents 50% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 12-cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.en: Pascuala is 39 years old, single and raises hogs in Amulung. She wants to improve the growth of her hogs so she has asked for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed for them. It will help her hogs grow healthier, leading to higher profits when the hogs are sold to butchers. She hopes to keep raising hogs to save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed for hogs

loans.name: Maximeno

texts.en:
Maximeno is a hardworking father from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 75 years old and ventures in managing his fish pond business.

He has signed his membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. He applied for a loan to purchase feed for his aquaculture business.

Maximeno hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his aquaculture business.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 76 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

Lucita grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She credits the Cooperative with providing her capital to support her gardening activities. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. 

In the future, Lucita wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is juggling business on her coconut farm and supervising the renovation of her family's home. 

Carmen hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 50,000.  She is thankful to the Cooperative as her financing partner who has not only supported her business, but also her other family needs.

loans.use: to renovate her home

loans.name: Sotero

texts.en:
Sotero always has enthusiasm for farming. He has cultivated his rice land in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, and he has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, he applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Sotero knows that he has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. 

In the future, Sotero hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 52 years old, married and has five children. She is a hog raiser and earns income by selling her hogs after they have achieved their desired weight. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and rice bran for her hogs. She hopes to keep raising healthy hogs to earn good profits.

loans.use: to buy feed and rice bran for her hogs.

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim is a 55-year-old, hard-working, married man with five children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

For the past seven years, he has been a farmer, in addition to selling animals. It is from these businesses that he has been able to sustain his family and take care of educating his children. Pests and diseases are his main challenges, but he hopes to increase his outputs.
 
Ephraim is requesting a loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Miguel Angel owns cows and sheep, which he fattens and then sells for their meat. He also cultivates corn, oat and zucchini for his family's own consumption. By investing in his biodigester, he will create a direct link between his animals and his activities on the field, as their manure will be transformed into a potent organic fertilizer that Miguel Angel will apply on his crops to increase their yield in a natural way, nourishing the soil without buying any chemicals. The biodigester also produces methane-rich biogas, which will be connected to the cookstove and boiler in the kitchen. Fossil fuel based LP gas will become unnecessary for the farm's operations, allowing the family to save money while protecting the environment and improving their quality of life. Indeed, as the manure will be treated inside the biodigester, it will no longer contaminate underground water sources, nor generate bad smells or attract flies.
This loan represents 46% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carmen cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Águilas Del Futuro, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 37  años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de  24, 20, 19, 17 y 15 años de edad. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña María es una muy buena esposa que le gusta trabajar para así lograr sus recursos y con estos poder salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña granja en la cual se dedica a la cría de pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños los mismos que cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende por libras a vecinos de sus localidad,  o entrega a comerciantes en este lugar, ella también le da parte del crédito para que su marido lo utilice en la agricultura, el siembra maíz en la época invernal.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos, medicinas para los animales, así como semillas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Lleva año y medio en el Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
“Las Águilas Del Futuro” [The Future Eagles] communal bank meet every day in the city of Carmen, a place known for being very dynamic.  Most of the people are engaged in agriculture and raising animals as it is an area with abundant vegetation.  

Maria lives in this place.  She is 37 years old, lives in a common-law relationship, and from this union, she has five children, ages 24, 20, 19, 17, and 15.  Her husband is a farmer. 

Maria is a good wife who enjoys working, and being able to earn money in order to get ahead.  She has a small farm where she raises chickens.  She buys these animals when they are still small, and raises them for three or four months until they attain an adequate weight.  Then she sells them by the pound to neighbors in her town, or delivers them to businesses in the area.  She also gives part of the loan to her husband to use for the farm when planting corn in the winter.  

This loan will be used to purchase chickens, feed, and medicine for the animals as well as seeds and fertilizer for the crops.  She has been a member of the communal bank for a year and a half, and she is pleased with the help she receives through the loans.  Her dream is to stay healthy and be able to keep going.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, feed, and medicine for the chickens as well as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita is a responsible housewife who supported her husband in gaining income to satisfy their daily necessities. She has been running a small variety store for almost ten years now. 

Solita wants to further improve her business to generate a higher income. She plans to acquire more goods to resell, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to access a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy more grocery items, fruits and vegetables that she will sell in their community. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Marcia Veronica

texts.es: Veronica se encuentra en sus 36 años de edad, ella esta casada y es una señora responsable en su hogar y cuida muy bien a sus 3  hijos de 1, 7 y 11 años de edad,  su esposo se dedica a trabajar en una mecánica, Veronica mientras vela por sus hijos también se dedica a crianza de animales menores, en esta ocasión va  a invertir el crédito en la compra de pollos, y de este negocio aspira apoyar a su esposo en lo necesario para los gastos de sus hijos y asi que tengan buena calidad de vida.
texts.en: Veronica is 36 years old. She is married and is a very responsible woman in her home. She takes very good care of her three children who are 1, 7 and 11 years old. Her husband works as a mechanic. Besides taking care of her children, Veronica also works raising small animals. This time she will use the loan to buy chickens. With this business she wants to support her husband with their children expenses so that in this way they have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is a widow who has had switched from selling snacks to selling longganisa (processed meat). Her business is doing well as she has perfected her own longganisa recipe. With her children's help and support, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She has requested a loan from PMPC to buy more kilos of meat for her longganisa business. Today, Conchita is able to help others run their own businesses selling longganisa and they have improved earning for their own families.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of meat for her business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is a businesswoman from Pagadian. She is 55 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Leonila is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out and repaid several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Leonila continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Enerio

texts.en: Enerio operates a motor transport business.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 300 PHP every day. For him to continue his business, he needs a loan to pay for spare parts and repairs. He dreams to own more motor units and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and repairs for his motor transport business.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sol De America Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Sol de América está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 18 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en un nivel de pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elvia quien es la presidenta, ella comenta que siempre se esfuerza para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener y evitar que pasen por necesidades. Ella vende ropas de manera ambulante, y de esa forma tiene los medios para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Elvia pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias, de manera a poder seguir trabajando y luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named “Sol de América” (Sun of America) is in its sixth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another so that they can get ahead. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program. The results indicated that 18 members are below the poverty line, which means that they are at an extreme poverty level.

One of the members is Sra. Elvia, who is the president. She says that she always strives to provide her family everything she was not able to have so that they can avoid being in need. Elvia sells clothes as a street vendor. This business gives her the means to improve her living conditions.

Sra. Elvia is requesting a loan in order to buy various clothes. This will enable her to keep working and progressing as she has done before.

loans.use: to buy various clothes to sell.

loans.name: Castelo

texts.en:
Castelo is 48 years old and manages a vulcanizing shop in his village. He manages his business well so he can acquire good profits in return. 

Castelo is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to invest in buying exterior and interior tires use in his shop. He will also use his loan for maintenance in his shop. He has had unstable income in his business, which is why he hopes to have another source of income someday.

loans.use: to buy exterior and interior tires to use in his shop

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is 58 years old and married but has no children. He is one of the tricycle operators in their community, while his wife manages a small retail store. 

To provide a better service and safe transportation to his passengers, he needs to replace his old side car. Due to capital insufficiency, he would like a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy the new side car and spare parts needed for his motorcycle. 

Through patience and hard work, Wilfred hopes that someday he will earn a higher income and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy a side car and spare parts for his motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is 44 years old and lives in Amulung with her family. To generate income, she has managed a sari-sari (variety) store, selling grocery items to the people in her village for about five years now. She wants to buy more goods to sell so she can meet her customers' demand. So, she is asking for PHP 5,000 to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, canned goods and soap to sell. She hopes to acquire good profits and become a successful vendor.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, canned goods and soap to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 69 years old and lives in Ozamiz City. She is married with three children. Remedios has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 1,800 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business. Remedios has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) since 2007.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva faces considerable preparation for the post-harvest operations of her palay (rice) farm in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her loan proposal to Paglaum MPC.  Genoveva hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is driven by her passion in selling. At the age of 52,  a widow in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Elsie runs a store that primarily supports her family. She never gets tired of tending her store. Elsie is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out and repaid several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to pay for sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities for her. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 38 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Sindangan, Philippines. Judith is a hard-working and diligent mother when it comes to her family and has always been known to provide the best for them. She and her husband earn a living through fishing. To generate more income, Judith decided to try seaweed production after she learned that she can receive financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, she has requested a loan to buy materials needed for this business. Judith smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her seaweed production business.

location.town: Sindangan-Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Jesse Neftali

texts.es:
Neftali, de 20 años de edad, está soltero, es comerciante, estudio hasta quinto grado y actualmente vive con sus padres y hermanos.

Neftali, es un joven que siempre aparta dinero para los gastos de la casa, tiene tres meses de trabajar como distribuidor independiente de productos naturales de una empresa, pero siempre ha trabajado en la agricultura y hasta trabajos de albañil realiza cuando alguien lo busca para hacerlos.

El necesita el crédito para contratar varias personas que le ayuden a cortar la cosecha de maíz y pagar una máquina desgranadora.

Neftali, en un futuro sueña con construir su propia casa y tener una familia.
texts.en:
20-year-old Neftali is a trader. He studied to fifth grade, is single and currently lives with his parents and brothers and sisters. 

He always puts money aside to cover household expenses. He has been working for three months as an self-employed distributor, delivering natural products for a company. However, he has always worked in agriculture and even does some building work when required.

He needs the loan to employ a number of people to help him harvest his corn and to pay for a corn-shelling machine.

Neftali's dream for the future is to build his own home and have a family.

loans.use: to employ a number of people to help him harvest his corn and to pay for a corn-shelling machine.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda is 54 years old and married with four children. Hermelinda works very hard to provide for them.

Hermelinda runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

Hermelinda has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Hermelinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and groceries

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 15 years and also earns income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Major

texts.en:
Major (23) lives in Soweto, South Africa with his wife, one year old child and his grandparents who he supports. 

Major owns an arts and crafts store selling local products such as carvings and beaded items. He is requesting a loan in order to buy new stock such as ebony art carvings, picture frames and local artist's drawings to sell. These items are very popular with tourists and he is sure he will be able to quickly sell them for a decent profit.

With the variety of products he'll add to his shop's stock he will also be able to attract new clientele and keep his business blooming. 

Major hopes that one day he will own many arts and crafts shops all across South Africa and improve his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to buy ebony art carvings, picture frames, paintings as well as local artist's drawings

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 25 year old. She is a mother of one child aged 3. She lives in Soweto with her two school going siblings aged 10 and 11 and her 80 years old grandmother. Janet is the sole breadwinner for the family. She is an excellent cook who makes very delicious local food. She makes a living by being hired to cook for guests during local community ceremonies like weddings and birthday parties.
Janet wants a loan to buy tables, chairs, cooking stove, deep freezer and utensils to establish a restaurant where she will prepare and serve her popular local meals to Customers throughout. She has found a business premises near a busy section of Soweto and she is seeking funding to start the restaurant business.
Her proven culinary skills, large number of existing customers and excellent business location will combine to make this business a success. To improve her business skills Janet is attending Siza's basic business skills training.

The business will enable Janet take her brother and sister to High School and also enable her provide better health care for her ailing grandmother.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, cooking stove, deep freezer and utensils to establish a restaurant

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia is a businesswoman from New Dapitan, Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 65 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little rice retailing business and earns a meager income that is adequate enough to support her family. 

Vergenia is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without record of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her rice retailing business with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Vergenia continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to successfully face all challenges with courage for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Jean Marie

texts.en:
Jean lives in Malvern, Johannesburg, with his wife and five children. 

He is a talented craftsman who uses wood to create rustic art carvings and furniture. His pieces are unique, attracting a diverse range of clientele including some from outside South Africa.

Jean is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy a large consignment of rare wood as well as upgrade his workshop. 
With this loan Jean wants to source bulk wood directly from suppliers thus benefiting from economies of scale as well as reducing his final product price due to lower costs of production. 

In the future, Jean hopes to expand his workshop into a large-scale manufacturer employing many people as well as set-up a training program to pass on his skills.

loans.use: to buy a large consignment of rare wood .

loans.name: Portial

texts.en:
30 year old Portial lives in Soweto, a South African township. She is an enterprising young mother of two, aged 6 and 3 and she supports her younger brother.

She set up a business selling flowers and managing events such as launches and weddings which require color and impact. Her husband is a partner in the business and she has two people working for her.

Her business is clearly doing well but she is ambitious for greater success but she needs an injection of capital to expand. With the loan she intends to buy party tents, chairs, tables and colorful containers.

Her goal is to increase her profits so that the family can move to a better home and in the longer term to expand beyond Soweto to open a shop in Johannesburg CBD.

loans.use: to buy party tents, chairs, tables and colorful containers.

loans.name: Palesa

texts.en:
Palesa is a young lady who loves fashion and follows all the latest trends. Though she comes from an economically disadvantaged background, she aspires to own her own big retailing store one day. Her sense and love for fashion is what makes her unique from everyone else in her community. 

Palesa needs a loan to buy ladies clothes, baby clothes and shoes to start her clothing retail business in a popular part of Soweto. From this shop, Palesa will sell her selection of clothes and accessories and earn a decent income to fulfill her dream of becoming a successful businesswoman.

The business will enable her take care of her two younger siblings and her young child as she is the only bread winner in the family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, baby clothes and shoes

loans.name: Jerlinda

texts.en:
Jerlinda is a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is 48 years old and she is a widow. She has three children and all of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, she was able to raise her children well.

Jerlinda owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the stores are just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Jerlinda gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price then she will sell them, per piece, for a higher price to have a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby, and the people in the community. She earns PHP 1,000 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, Jerlinda is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her in adding more products to her store.

Jerlinda desires to have an expansion of her store. She hopes to have enough strength everyday and a longer and happier life for her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio has a coconut farm in Calamba, Philippines, which is the primary source of income for his family. To generate additional earnings, he wants to plant bananas and grow root crops.

Gregorio makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. He recently needed a loan to pay for clearing and ploughing of land and holing and planting of seedlings, which he borrowed from Paglaum MPC.

Gregorio wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and ploughing of his land.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 34 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Lilian works very hard to provide for them.

Lilian runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years now. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like purified water, canned goods, groceries, etc.

In the future, Lilian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like purified water, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is a hard-working mother from Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old and a businesswoman who makes her poultry business a successful one. 

Salve has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to purchase vitamins and feed for her poultry business. 

Salve hopes to succeed in this business, to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Grupo Estrella Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está conformado por tres mujeres (Xiomara, Isabel y Lilian) de la  ciudad de Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan  por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de ropa y calzados; Escogieron el nombre Estrella, ya que son mujeres que han tomado la decisión de trabajar juntas para salir adelante y ser ejemplos para otras mujeres, que llegarán a superarse y ser estrellas en sus respectivos negocios. Con el crédito otorgado anteriormente por Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, les permitió a las tres integrantes del grupo incrementar un poco más sus inventarios, diversificar los productos y mejorar sus ingresos porque han logrado vender más.

Isabel: Es una mujer cordial, Integrante del Grupo Solidario Estrella, casada, tiene 50 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos: Tres son mayores de edad y un adolecente de 15 años que cursa su 2do año de la secundaria. Tiene varios años de experiencia como pequeña comerciante de ropa nueva y calzado, gracias a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por Pana Pana le han permitido diversificar su oferta de productos y surtir su tramo poco a poco. Está solicitando financiamiento para incrementar su inventario de ropa y calzado, los cuales comprará en Managua y Masaya para poder ofertar a precios más accesibles para la población y clientela en Bilwi. Su sueño es ampliar el local donde vende sus productos para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes y poder organizar mejor la exhibición de su mercadería.
texts.en:
This group consists of three women (Xiomara, Isabel, and Lilian) who are from the city of Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who strive to grow their small clothing and shoe businesses. The members selected the name “Estrella” (Star). These women decided to work together so that they could move forward and become role models for other women. They want to succeed and become superstars in their respective businesses. With the previous Kiva loan they received from Pana Pana, the three members were able to increase their inventories slightly, diversify their products, and improve their profits because they were able to sell more.

Isabel is a cordial woman who is a member of the solidarity group named “Estrella”. She is 50 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are grown and the youngest is 15 years old and is in the second year of high school. Isabel has several years of experience as a small clothing and shoe merchant. Thanks to the loans she previously received from Pana Pana, she has been able to diversify the products that she offers and restock her business a little bit at a time. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her inventory of clothes and shoes. Isabel will buy products in Managua and Masaya so that she can offer the most affordable prices to her customers who live in Bilwi. Her dream is to expand the shop where she sells her products so that her customers can be more comfortable. This would also allow her to better organize the display of her merchandise.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es: Doña Timotea de 50 años de edad es madre soltera estudio únicamente su primer año de primaria debido a que sus padres eran de muy bajos recursos económicos y se les hizo difícil seguirle apoyando para que fuera a la escuela. Es madre de cuatro hijos quienes trabajan y en su casa de habitacion solo dos nietos viven quienes le apoyan en los quehaceres del hogar y en el campo junto a sus demás hijos. Doña Timotea trabaja en la agricultura desde que era muy pequeña teniendo más de 35 años de experiencia en el cultivo de café pues fue gracias a su padre por quien aprendió este trabajo. Al ver que no había probabilidades de estudiar se esforzó en aprenderlo ya que pensó que en un futuro este rubro seria su fuente de ingreso siendo en la actualidad verdadero. La siembra y cultivo de café, maíz y Frijol son la fuente de ingresos en su familia y hogar con lo que han salido adelante y han superado los obstáculos a lo largo de este tiempo. Sus cultivos de café están a una distancia aproximada de 500 metros desde su casa de habitacion a la cual se traslada caminando involucrándose únicamente sus hijos y sus dos nietos. Esa distancia manifiesta ella no es una dificultad cuando se trata de obtener resultados positivos pues estos se encuentran en el esfuerzo que se haga para que a sus cultivos de café no les falte lo necesario para mantenerse sanos y protegidos. Por esta razón ella solicita financiamiento el cual será utilizado para comprar 10 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0, 8 botes de foliar, 4 bolsas de KCL, 6 bolsas de fórmula 12-24-12, 100 bolsas de abono orgánico y para mantener más privado su cultivo 4 royos de alambre de púas con los que podrá evitar el acceso indebido a la propiedad por animales como vacas, burros, etc. por lo cual espera ser apoyada.
texts.en:
Doña Timotea is a 50 year old single mother with only one year of primary education as her parents were of very limited means which made it difficult to continue supporting her so she had to leave school. She is the mother of four children who work and her two grandchildren live at her home helping with household chores and in the fields with her other children. 

Timotea has worked in agriculture since she was very little. She has more than 35 years of experience in the cultivation of coffee which she learned from her father. Since there was no opportunity for her to receive an education she applied herself her learning this type of work as she thought that this category would become her source of income in the future, which has been the case in actuality. 

The planting and cultivation of coffee, corn, and beans are the source of income for her family and home with which they have been able to come out ahead and overcome obstacles over a long period of time. Her coffee plantation is approximately 500 meters from her home which she commutes walking with only her children and two grandchildren. This distance isn't difficult when the results are positive but these come from hard-work to ensure the coffee plants are not without the necessary maintenance and protection. For this reason she is requesting financing towards the purchase of 10 QQ of formula 18-46-0, 8 pots of leaf fertilizer, 4 bags of KCL, 6 bags of formula 12-24-12, 100 bags of organic compost and to keep her plantation more private 4 rolls of barbed wire with which she can prevent unwanted access to the property by cows, donkeys, etc. for which she awaits support.

loans.use: To purchase formula 12-24-12, 18-46-0, organic compost and leaf fertilizer to assist in coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Aliou Abou

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle Aliou Abou, c’est un jeune de 30 ans, marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans le commerce depuis 8 ans. Il n’a pas toujours géré sa propre boutique car il a travaillé pour des particuliers qui lui payaient un salaire. C’est après mûre réflexion et beaucoup de sacrifice, qu’il a ouvert sa propre boutique, mais aussi grâce à l’appui de l’IMCEC en partie. Il vient solliciter un montant de 500 000 pour renouveler son stock de marchandises : riz, huile, tomate, sucre. Il est actif de 7h à 22h et gère lui-même. Il est chargé de donner la dépense quotidienne.
Dans un futur proche, il aimerait élargir son espace commercial et diversifier l’activité.
texts.en:
Aliou Abou is a 30-year-old man who is married with children. He has been engaged in commercial activities for 8 years. He used to be employed by other people who paid him a salary. 

After much pondering, many sacrifices, and the financial support of IMCEC, he decided to open his own store. He is seeking a loan of 500,000Fcfa to replenish his stock of rice, oil, tomatoes, sugar, etc. He works from 7:00 A.M. until 10:00 P.M. and he runs the store himself. He is responsible for day-to-day expenses. 

In the near future, he would like to expand his commercial premises and diversify his activity.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as rice, oil, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma has a buy-and-sell business in Ozamiz City. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from the earnings of her business.
