En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de enaguas (faldas para mujeres de pollera); da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años, de forma independiente, sin embargo conocía este negocio desde niña, ya que apoyaba a su madre en el mismo negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud  y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Litoral” will begin its third cycle at ProMujer as part of the Villa Exaltación focal center. The group is composed of 11 members and is headed by a board of which Juana is the president. Businesses that the members of the communal bank carry forth are varied. Among them are selling chuño (dehydrated potatoes), selling chickens, selling food, selling vegetables, selling skirts, selling refreshments, selling livestock, selling salchipapa [a dish of sausages and potatoes], and selling potatoes. 

The loan is a great benefit for small microentrepreneurs like Juana. She began working with ProMujer two years ago, entering on the invitation of a promoter of the institution who went to visit her home in the past. Today she has a business selling petticoats (women’s skirts). She says that she began this business independently several years ago but knew this work since childhood because she helped her mother in the same business.

The credit she is taking out if for an increase in capital to buy fabric wholesale from the sellers in the city of El Alto. Then she will make her products and market them in her selling space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about ProMujer, Juana says she likes the health services and training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fabric to make women's petticoats

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has a coconut farm. She finds pleasure in doing her farming activities and earns income as well for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she seeks financial help to purchase fertilizer and to pay for workers' labor. 

In the future, Rebecca wishes to own an additional coconut farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Reggie

texts.en:
Reggie is responsible and dedicated in his work as a tailor. He has chosen to live as a single man with his parents in Sindangan. His business is his only source of income to support his needs and those of his elderly parents. He is very grateful for his life and for being allowed to be independent. 

He has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes and bags. This business has given him the opportunity to work and survive.

Reggie applied for a loan in order to expand his business and increase production. He will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow him to generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie has started her small business and became a boss with her sari-sari (general) store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profits. Every day she has good sales since she is the only store in her village. 

Recently, she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities, such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Yetchel

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Yetchel works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from an electronic load business. Yetchel is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Yetchel has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Precilita

texts.en:
Precilita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Precilita is 56 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Precilita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Precilita has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 43 year old married woman with six children. Five attend school. Leonora works very hard to provide for them.

Leonora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Leonora would like to send her children to college.

loans.use: to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Adela works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Adela is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy rice to sell to customers.

Adela has sustained her business activities with 25 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to expand her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ana Marlene

texts.es: Marlene esta casada, tiene 28 años de edad, sus 2 hijos tienen 5 y 7  años de edad y asisten  a la escuela, ella creció con sus padres en el campo y su fuente de ingresos es la crianza de animales menores, su esposo trabaja al jornal de trabajos de agricultura, el crédito  lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para mejorar su negocio y asi apoyar en los gastos del hogar para sus hijos y sobre todo que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en: 28-year-old Marlene is married with two children of 5 and 7, both of whom go to school. She grew up with her parents in the country and she earns her income breeding small animals. Her husband works in agriculture as a day labourer. She will use the loan to buy chickens to improve her business and thereby contribute to the household expenses and ensure that her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 48 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Zosima is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this for 10 years.

Zosima is working tirelessly to attainment her dream: to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda esta divorciada, tiene 24 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 2 años, Fernanda vive en la casa de su madre y se dedica a la comercialización de ropa interior, comenta que lo compra en grande cantidad y que asi le sale mas barato, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa interior, la aspiración de Fernanda es mejorar su negocio y sacar adelante a su hija ya que el padre de la niña no lo apoya en los gastos.
texts.en: Fernanda is divorced. She is 24 years old and has a two-year-old child. Fernanda lives in her mother’s house and sells underwear. She comments that she buys in large quantities to get a cheaper price so she will use the loan to invest in buying underwear. Fernanda’s aspiration is to improve her business and raise her daughter because the girl’s father does not support her financially.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia is 65 years old and widowed. She lives in Dapitan, Dipolog City. 

For the past 15 years, Pacencia has been a farmer. She earns 3,000 PHP each month and has been a  member of PMPC since 2006. 

Pacencia is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, breads, candies, beverages, seasonings and laundry soaps to resell

loans.name: Macedonia

texts.en:
Macedonia has been preparing considerably for the post harvest operations of her coconut farm in Dapitan. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. 

She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and made a loan. Macedonia hopes to see all of her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in Bacoor, Cavite Philippines and is married to Alberto, a factory supervisor. They have four children. 

She manages her household and operates her business. Emily sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products to augment their income, to help meet daily household needs and pay school fees.

Emily's regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every week.

To help sustain her business, Emilt is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to buy merchandise like beauty products, clothing, toiletries and beauty products to sell.

Filipinos prefer to buy her name branded personal goods for their good quality. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that will be given to her.   

Emily aims to grow her business and seeks a good place to display her products. She prays for a healthy family and dreams that all her children will finish college and that they will live quiet lives.  

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like beauty products, clothing, toiletries and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Teothelma

texts.en:
In 2012, Teothelma learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends to a small time lender like her. She tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

She has requested another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help her gain more income in her chosen business. Teothelma looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

location.town: Sindangan-R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is 52 years old and married with four children. With two children still in school, Primitiva works very hard to provide for them.

Primitiva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Primitiva has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, snack foods, noodles, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Primitiva would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is 58 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Martina runs a pig fattening business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been running the pig fattening for 21 years and also earns an income from gardening.

Martina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Martina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 46 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc..

Evelyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as beverages, coconuts, candies, eggs, school supplies and junk food.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 54 years old and married with four children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell at her store, such as canned goods, condiments and groceries.

Lydia has borrowed and paid back loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns income from farming rice.

Lydia aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell at her store, such as canned goods, condiments and groceries.

loans.name: Jose Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Antonio es un señor muy trabajador, tiene 65 años de edad y su único hijo ya es independiente, la esposa de Antonio se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar  y lo apoya en el negocio de ganadería y de crianza de animales menores, Antonio se dedica a la agricultura,  a la ganadería y al jornal, el cerdito lo necesita para comprar una vaca ya que dice que por medio del ordeño y de la venta de leche se apoya en las cuotas del crédito y asi quedan bien, la aspiración de Antonio es mejorar su negocio y tener una vejez digna con su esposa.
texts.en: Antonio is a hardworking gentleman who is 65 years old. His only son is already independent. Antonio’s wife does household chores and supports him in the business of raising livestock and small animals. Antonio works in agriculture, livestock, and is a day laborer. He needs a loan to buy a cow. Through milking the cow and selling the milk, he will be able to meet his loan repayments well. Antonio’s aspiration is to improve his business and have a dignified old age with his wife.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to sell milk

loans.name: Gabriela Karina

texts.es: Carina es una señora de 24 años de edad, vive en una casa prestada juntamente con su esposo y su hijo de 5 años que asiste a la escuela, comenta que se dedica unos  5 años al negocio  de las frutas, trabaja con sus padres y  este negocio es familiar, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para comercializarlas, dice que se transporta a diferentes ferias de algunas ciudades, la aspiración de Carina es  mejorar su negocio y variar mas sus productos para ofrecer buena mercadería a sus clientes y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos y comprar una casa propia
texts.en: Karina is a young woman of 24 years of age. She lives in a borrowed house together with her husband and a 5-year-old son who attends school. She says that she has been in business selling fruit for five years. She works with her parents in this family business. The loan will be used to invest in buying fruit to sell. She transports fruit to different markets in different cities. Karina’s aspiration is to improve her business and vary the products she offers to have a good stock of merchandise to sell to her customers, thereby increasing her income so she can buy a home.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Enkhjargal, 35, lives with her parents in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. She has been working as a teacher at a kindergarten since 2005. Her parents have retired from work and they receive a state pension. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel. She will use this environmentally friendly car for transportation between home and work.

loans.use: to buy an electric car for personal use.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 36 years old, married and has a child. She is a raising hogs for income. She sells the raised hogs to butchers. 

She is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy feed, rice bran and medicines used in sustaining hogs. 

Someday, he hopes to increase her income and save funds for the family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed, rice bran and medicines used in sustaining hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in new company assets for business expansion and increased profits, so that her employees can afford healthcare plans.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se ubica el grupo Sagrado Corazón fue fundada por familias que se dedicaban al cultivo de plátano, mango, naranja, limón los cuales salían a vender a poblaciones vecinas. Con el paso del tiempo, la caña de azúcar se posicionó en el primer lugar de producción. En la entrada de la comunidad se puede ver un ingenio. Las integrantes del grupo de préstamo y sus actividades son:

Irma, Delfina, Paula - Ropa 
Mayra, Alma -Servicio De Internet
María - Calzado 
Shely - Acero Inoxidable Y Oro Laminado
Virginia - Hamacas 
Viridiana – Comida

La señora Virginia es una mujer muy comprometida con su familia. Los 7 años que tiene de radicar en la comunidad los ha dedicado a la elaboración y venta de hamacas, catres y sillones tejidos con hilo el cual compra en grandes cantidades en Chiapas (un estado distinto de donde ella vive) obteniéndolo a mejor precio ya que los proveedores le conocen por ser originaria de ese lugar. Actualmente, dos de sus hijas viven con ella mientras que su hijo vive con su abuela en Chiapas. "Quizá suene peligroso mas no lo es, yo aprendí a tejer las hamacas en el reclusorio cuando visitaba a un pariente que se encontraba preso". Actualmente Virginia sigue yendo al reclusorio a enseñar a algunos reclusos a tejer, a aprender nuevas técnicas de ellos o a comprar las bases de los catres que también se fabrican dentro y que ella necesita para hacer sus productos.

Las inversiones más grandes del negocio de Virginia las hace en la compra de hilo, por lo que los préstamos han representado un gran apoyo para mantener su actividad. Esta vez no es la excepción, pues necesita nuevamente capital para hilo y guardacabos para ofrecer con ellos una mayor durabilidad de los brazos de las hamacas.

“Las hamacas son fáciles de transportar, el cliente suele relajarse al acostarse en una hamaca. Si bien hoy en día pocas personas valoran el trabajo que realizamos quienes tejemos hamacas a mano, también hay quienes sí muestran aprecio y respeto por las artesanías" eso es lo que a Virginia le agrada y comenta que su principal reto es vender las hamacas al precio justo pues hay quienes no quieren pagar por su valor y a ello se enfrenta día con día.

El grupo agradece a VisionFund por los préstamos otorgados pues con ellos cada una ha logrado el crecimiento de su actividad.

*En la imagen se puede apreciar en el fondo algunas máquinas que conforman el pequeño cibercafé de doña Paula, también se observa un perezoso azul el cual tejió la señora Virginia quien viste de blusa amarilla.
texts.en:
The community where the group Sagrado Corazón is located was founded by families devoted to the cultivation of bananas, mangoes, oranges, and lemons that they sell in neighboring towns. Over time, sugarcane became their number one product. There is a sugar factory at the entrance of the community. The members of this loan group and their activities are:

Irma, Delfina, and Paula sell clothing.
Mayra and Alma provide Internet services.
Maria sells footwear.
Shely works with stainless steel and plated gold.
Virginia works with hammocks.
Viridiana sells food.

Virginia is a woman who is very committed to her family. She has been making and selling hammocks, cots, and chairs with woven strings for seven years. She buys materials in bulk in Chiapas (a different state from where she lives) where she gets it at a better price. Her suppliers know her to be a native of her hometown. Currently, two of her daughters live with her whole a son lives with his grandmother in Chiapas. “It may sound dangerous but it is not, I learned to weave hammocks in the prison while visiting a relative who was imprisoned.” Currently, Virginia continues to go to the prison to teach some inmates to knit, learn new techniques, or to buy the supplies for the cots that they also make in prison and that she needs to make her products.

The largest business investment that Virginia makes is thread. The loans have been a great support to maintain her activity. This time is no exception, she needs capital again to buy thread and thimbles to make the handles of the hammocks more durable. 

“The hammocks are easy to transport, the clients relax by lying in a hammock. While today, few people appreciate the work we who weave hammocks by hand do, there are those who do show appreciation and respect the craft.” That’s what Virginia likes and she says her main challenge is to sell the hammocks at a good price because there are those who do not want to pay the full price. She confronts this problem daily.

The group thanks VisionFund for the loans granted to them because each has increased their business.

*In the picture, you can see the machines that Paula has in her Internet cafe. You can also see a blue knitted lounge chair made by Virginia who wears a yellow blouse.

loans.use: to purchase thread to make hammocks and other furniture

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan, which she will use as to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she will sell at retail. More items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source of funds to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Wilma dreams of having a bigger general store and hopes that all her children will finish college and have their own careers. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalina is 48 years old. Three of her children are currently in school.

Rosalina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

Rosalina has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 46 years old and married with seven children. 

Rufina is in the agriculture business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Rufina requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

Rufina has been raising cattle for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rufina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 54 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell at her store, like canned goods and groceries.

Carmelita has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell at her store, like canned goods and groceries.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is single and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mary Grace requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional fish and salt for her business.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and salt for her dried fish vending business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and two of her children are in school.

Juliet has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy nail polish and other materials needed for her business.

Juliet has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nail polish and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Igliseria

texts.en: As the married parent of five children, Igliseria works hard to support her family by running a fishing business in the Philippines. She earns additional income by selling fish, and is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 from NWTF to buy additional equipment that she needs such as nets. Igliseria has sustained her business with the help of four prior loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other equipment for her business

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 61 years old and widowed with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Concepcion is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Concepcion has been raising pigs for thirty years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 45 years old and married with five children. With one child currently in school, Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items for resale at her store, such as soft-drinks, coffee, cereals, juice, candies, biscuits, beer and cooking oil.

Rosalie has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items, such as soft-drinks, coffee, cereals, juice, candies, biscuits, beer and cooking oil. 

Rosalie would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items for resale at her store, such as soft-drinks, coffee, cereals, juice, candies, biscuits, beer and cooking oil.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 53 years old and married with two children.

Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries for resale.

Edna has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income from a food vending business.

Edna aspires to save money in order to support financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Veronica works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from raising chickens. Veronica is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money for business expansion and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Angelica Lupana

texts.es: Angelica es una señora de 53 años de edad, ella esta casada y sus 3 hijos son mayores de edad, el esposo de Angelica trabaja en el municipio de operador del agua potable, Angelica se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, el crédito lo necesita para comprar  chanchos y de este negocio espera mejorarlo y salir adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Angelica, age 53, is a married woman with three children, all of whom are of age. Her husband works for the municipality's water utility. Angelica works raising livestock. She needs this loan to buy pigs, and improve her business to keep making things better for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Met is 33 years old and married with two young children. She lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. To earn a living to support the family, she cultivates rice earning USD 4 a day and her husband works as a construction worker, earning USD 5 a day. Met has been cultivating rice for over 14 years. 

Now she wants to buy soil to fill her land in order to build a proper house, but she lacks the finances. For that reason, she has decided to secure a loan. With the loan, she will be able to start building the new house. Her plans are to build a house, and support her children to go through high school, and if possible, to earn bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to buy soil to fill her land.

loans.name: Mujeres De Palabra Group

texts.es: Este es la Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres De Palabra”  la cual lo conforma 05 socias emprendedoras y solidarias. Virginia de 39 años de edad es casada y tiene 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Hace más de 10 años que viene desempeñándose en dicho negocio el cual le va bien. Su mayor deseo es poner su propio local de venta, ya que hasta el momento lo realiza de manera ambulatoria. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de camisas, pantalones y polos. El grupo  “Mujeres De Palabra” agradecen el crédito brindado. Virginia es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo azul.
texts.en:
This is the communal bank Mujeres De Palabra [Women of Word] which is made up 5 enterprising and supportive members. 

Virginia is 39 years old, is married and has three dependent children. She makes a living from the sale of clothing. For more than 10 years she has been working in this business which is doing well. Her biggest wish is to be able to have her own storefront as, up until now, she has been working as a street vendor. She has requested the loan to purchase shirts, trousers and polo t shirts. 

The Mujeres de Palabra group appreciate the loan that has been offered. Virginia is the first on the left hand side in the blue top.

loans.use: to purchase of shirts, trousers and polo t shirts.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 40 years old, widowed, and has two children. She stands alone to sustain the needs of her family. She is managing a small store and a hog raising business to gain income. In her store, she sells grocery items, and she wants to increase the goods she sells. 

That is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell. This will help increase sales capacity and profits as well. She hopes to further develop her businesses and achieve income stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy snack foods, beverages, noodles, canned goods, laundry soaps, soft drinks, seasonings and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cloth in batches of a dozen, improving her business and providing a better quality of life for her young son.

loans.name: Sin Ku Village Group 2

texts.en: Sin Ku Village is located in Myanmar's Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, and five residents who are in a CBO (community-based organization) oversee a group of 25 village customers. This loan will help some group members buy both ducks and ducklings that they will use to increase their income by selling their eggs. The remaining group members will use their funds to buy high-quality feed (which costs $20 to feed 100 ducks for five days). Sin Ku village is an agricultural community where many people are farmers who grow rice and plant seasonal vegetables and fruits such as bananas and coconuts. Those without arable land grow livestock, including ducks and chickens.  Some also raise pigs as a way to set aside some savings. The picture above shows four CBO members, U Tin, U Ngwe, Daw Nwe and Daw Moe. U Tin (second from the left) is 62 years old and owns a two-acre farm. He is married with two daughters. In addition to planting seasonal fruits on his land, U Tin raises ducks and pigs. His wife takes care of the ducks, and they also run a small grocery store out of their house. U Tin is excited to receive Proximity's loan because it will help him buy high-quality duck feed, which will allow him to increase his income by selling more and higher-quality duck eggs as well as well-nourished ducks.

loans.use: to help villagers buy ducks and high-quality feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a flower shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening businesses. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more flowers to offer for sale.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to offer for sale.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
María, de 71 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 6 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado.

María, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también a la comercialización de ganado y cerdo.- Además, tiene ganado bovino que también comercializa.- Por medio de empleados, cultiva algunas parcelas de tierra con granos básicos como maíz, maicillo y frijol.

El préstamo lo utilizara para aportarlo en obras de construcción en la iglesia donde ella se congrega, ya que siempre ha tenido la costumbre y el buen corazón de ayudar en obras de beneficio para la comunidad.

A futuro desea, reparar un establo donde tiene ganado y hacer un muro de contención cerca de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 71 years old, is widowed, has 6 children all of which are of age. She studied up to third grade.

María dedicates her time to both domestic duties as well as the marketing of livestock and pigs. In addition she has cattle which she also sells. By means of  her employees, she cultivates some plots of land with basic grains such as corn, sorghum and beans.

She will use the loan to support construction works in the church she attends. She has always had the habit and good heart to help in works which benefit the community. 

In the future she wishes to repair a livestock stable and construct a retaining wall near her house.

loans.use: to contribute to construction works in the church she attends.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is 46 years old, single, and lives at Amulung. She sells AVON and NATASHA products such as cosmetics, perfumes, bags and soaps. She is patiently involved in this kind of business to gain income and sustain daily needs. She also allows credits on her merchandise, but collects them before the due dates. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy bags, cosmetics, and soap to sell. She hopes to continuously extend good products and services and to acquire good profits in return.

loans.use: to buy bags, cosmetics, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sidecar and pay to renew the license and registration of his motorcycle

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for her Piso Net business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 14,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and computer parts needed in her Piso Net business. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family, if the units are regularly maintained and in good condition.

Annalie wants to add more units of Piso Net, so she can increase her profits and continue to sustain the needs of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional Piso Net unit for her business.

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 53 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vevencia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Vevencia has requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 52 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Rosie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing.

Rosie has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan.

Rosie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia works hard to support her family. Antonia is married and has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

In the future, Antonia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Bonifacia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Bonifacia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Bonifacia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is married and she works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Janice has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Daisy works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Daisy is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Alto Mariscal Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALTO MARISCAL SANTA CRUZ” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elva es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chamarras, venta de ropa de militar, venta de chompas, venta de peluches, venta de abrigos, tienda de barrio, venta de chocolates. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elva es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chamarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años indicando como empleado de un taller de costura, posteriormente con un poco de capital y conocimientos acerca del negocio decide implementarlo independientemente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud  y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución y la atención de la Asesora.

En la imagen se identifica la ausencia de una de las clientes, la misma se encontraba en el consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The communal bank “ALTO MARISCAL SANTA CRUZ” will initiate their 10th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of Juan Pablo II.  The group has 9 members and it is directed by an executive committee where Elva is the President.  The businesses of the members of the communal association are various, among them are: sale of jackets, sale of military clothing, sale of sweaters, sale of stuffed toys, sale of coats, mini mart and sale of chocolates.

The loan will benefit small business owners of this group which Elva belongs to. She has been a part of this group for 8 years, she join when she was invited by her sister who is a client of the institution. Currently she works selling jackets.  She learned this trade a few years ago when she was employed in a sewing shop and after that with a little capital and knowledge of the business she decided to go independent.

The loan she is requesting is to increase the capital (to buy fabric in bulk). She will acquire it from the vendors of El Alto city. This line of work allows her to generate resources to financially support her family. She is married and has 4 children.

When ask what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services, the workshops and the attention of the Advisor.

In the photo you can identify that one of the members is missing, she was at the doctor’s office.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Jerlie

texts.en:
This is Jerlie. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jerlie hopes that her business will continue to become successful, and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like undergarments, deodorant, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, zippers, two tables, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Las Ñustas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS ÑUSTAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Graciela ella es casada y tiene 36 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,uvas,platanos y mandarinas, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas y verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos, uvas, cebollas, zanahorias y pepinos. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de carne, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Las Ñustas." The bank is located in the Cusco District, which is part of the Cusco Province in the Cusco Region. 

Graciela is a member; she is married and is thirty-six years old. She works selling fruits and vegetables. She sells apples, oranges, grapes, bananas, and mandarins; she also sells carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Though this work, she wants to get her children ahead. She has a stall in the market where she sells her fruits and vegetables. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She has had this business for 7 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have her own retail space where she could sell fruits and vegetables. She is asking for this loan to buy oranges, bananas, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers. 

The other members work in animal sales, meat sales, a grocery store, and selling food. 

She is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through this platform and promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, bananas, grapes, onions, carrots and cucumbers.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is 55 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now in their adult age. Nilda is engaged in a dressmaking business as her main source of living. She's been in this business for 30 years. She earns approximately PHP 4,500 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional assorted cloth, threads and accessories for her dressmaking business. Nilda has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for almost 11 years. In the future, Nilda hopes to build her own tailoring business.

loans.use: To be used to purchase additional assorted cloth, threads and accessories

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
María, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera, vive únicamente con su hijo y un sobrino, quienes son los que dependen de ella, su madre emigro hacia los Estados Unidos hace 10 años y su padre quien quedo con ella, murió hace 2 años. 

María, hace un tiempo trabajo en un CDI, pero actualmente trabaja en la elaboración de hamacas, oficio que lo aprendió de su madre, quien antes de emigrar también hacía hamacas, para cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Este Oficio lo realiza desde hace 20 años, trabaja todo el día y todos los días, pues lo hace en su casa y así no descuida a su hijo y a su sobrino.

María, está solicitando el crédito para comprar hilo se seda, ya q son indispensables para poder seguir con su negocio de elaboración de hamacas y de esta manera poder satisfacer de una manera mejor a sus clientes, mejorar su trabajo, mejorar también los ingresos económicos en su hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de las personas que viven junto a ella.

María, sueña con ver crecer a su hijo, poder ayudarle hasta que realice sus estudios y obtenga su título y llegue a ser todo un profesional.- También, desea seguir en su negocio, mejorar poco a poco el taller para que crezca su número de clientes.
texts.en:
María, 36 years old, went to school through secondary school, is a single mother, and lives just with her son and a nephew, who are those who depend on her. Her mother emigrated to the United States 10 years ago and her father, who stayed with her, died 2 years ago.

A while ago, María worked in a CDI [a child development center], but currently she works making hammocks, work that she learned from her mother who, before emigrating, also made hammocks, to pay for her family's needs. She has been in this trade for 20 years, she works all day and every day, and she does it in her house so she doesn't neglect her son and her nephew. 

María is applying for the loan to purchase silk thread, since it is indispensable to be able to continue with her business making hammocks and in this way be able to satisfy her customers better, improve her work, also increase her household income, and improve her quality of life and that of the people who live with her.

María dreams of seeing her son grow up, being able to help him until he finishes his education and gets a degree, and becomes a professional. She also wants to continue in her business, improve her shop bit by bit so that her number of customers increases.

loans.use: to buy silk thread.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La señora Maribel, tiene 26 años de edad, tiene un grado de instrucción de nivel bachiller, está casada con el señor Luis, ambos tienen 1 hijo dependiente a su cargo, la señora se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, cuenta con 23 cabezas de ganado de semoviente, de los cuales 18 están en etapa de producción y el resto en etapa de gestación, actualmente la señora vive a 8 km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive es de sus padres, el destino del crédito es para la compra de un camión de cascara de soya que es alimento para su ganado lechero, actualmente es muy escaso el alimento para ganado por la zona y es difícil adquirirlo en esta época.
texts.en: Maribel is 26 years old, obtained an educational level of secondary school, is married to Luis, and they have 1 dependent child in their care. She works making raw milk, she has 23 head of cattle, of which 18 are in the production stage and the rest are in the gestation stage.  Currently she lives 8 km from the city of Cochabamba. The house where she lives belongs to her parents. The loan will be used to purchase a truckload of soybean shells, which is food for her dairy cows. At the moment, food for cattle is very scarce in the zone and it is difficult to get it in this season.

loans.use: to purchase a truckload of soybean shells which is food for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena makes a good earning on her farming activities, planting vegetables and any agricultural commodity in Sindangan, Zamboanga del No. This is how she supports her husband in addition to his income for their family and how she is able to send her children to school. Because she wants to increase her farm yield, she approached Paglaum for a loan amount to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this crop season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and a knapsack sprayer for insecticides

location.town: Sindangan-R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocksof used clothing and snack foods to resell

loans.name: Martha Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carmen cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Buenos Aires, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 50  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 10 hijos mayores de  edad e independientes. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Martha es una muy buena esposa que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría pollos, compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños los mismos que cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende por libras a vecinos de sus localidad  o entrega a comerciantes en este lugar, ella también le da parte del crédito para que su marido lo utilice en la agricultura, el siembra maíz, maní y verduras en la época invernal.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para pollos, semillas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the city of Carmen, the communal bank group Buenos Aires meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, and for being a zone with a lot of vegetation. 

Martha lives in this place. She is 50 years old, married, and from this relationship has 10 adult children who are independent. Her husband is a farmer.

Martha is a good wife who likes to work to get ahead. She has a small farm where she raises chickens. She purchases these animals when they are still small, raises them for a period of three or four months until they have an adequate weight, and later sells them by the pound to neighbors in the area or brings them to business people in this place. She also gives part of the loan so her husband uses it in agriculture. He grows corn, peanuts, and vegetables in the winter season. 

This loan will be used to purchase chickens, chicken feed and medicine, seeds, and fertilizer for the crops. She has been in the communal bank group for 4 years and she likes it for the help that she gets with the loans. Her dream is to have the health to continue on.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, chicken feed and medicine, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en: Rizza is from Oroquieta in the Philippines. She is 45 years old and is married. She and her husband are helping each other to raise their family. They were stretching their resources to sustain the family's needs, especially to pay for the education of her children. Rizza came up with the idea of starting a business since she has had the skills to bake delicious cakes, but she had no starting capital. She joined PMPC after hearing that she could avail herself of financial assistance. Rizza applied for a loan to start her cake baking business, which will be used to purchase additional bags of flour and other raw ingredients, to increase her production and to provide for more customers. Rizza is thankful for the financing she gets for her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand and improve her business to benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of flour and other raw ingredients to increase her production and to provide for more customers

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Gabriela Sonia

texts.es: La señora Gabriela, es de estado civil divorciada,ha logrado cursar hasta el nivel técnico en contaduría, ella cuenta que durante su matrimonio sufrió mucho, porque su esposo no trabajaba mientras  ella tenía que mantener a sus hijas y a él, actualmente ella cuenta con un trabajo estable en la sección de almacenes, realizando el despacho de mercaderías, por lo que tiene que sacrificar su salud, levantando cajas pesadas, todo porque cuenta con un mejor sueldo que en otros trabajos. Cuenta con una movilidad que se encuentra en mal estado, por lo que requiere un crédito para que se realice el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo, para que pueda tener mayor comodidad y poder desplazarse de un lugar a otro y continuar trabajando.
texts.en: Gabriela is divorced and was able to study through technical school in accounting. She says that she suffered a lot during her marriage because her husband didn't work while she had to support him and their children. She currently has a stable job shipping merchandise in the warehouse sector, for which she has to sacrifice her health by carrying heavy boxes all because it has a better salary than other jobs. She has a car that is in poor condition so she requires a loan to do maintenance and repairs on her vehicle so she can be more comfortable, get from one place to another, and continue working.

loans.use: to do maintenance and repairs on her vehicle so she can be more comfortable, get from one place to another, and continue working.

loans.name: Andrés Armando

texts.es:
Andrés es un hombre trabajador de 50 años de edad, está casado y tiene 3 hijos.

Andrés se dedica al comercio de ganado y especies menores, esta actividad la realiza desde antes de conocer a su esposa, lo cual les sirvió de mucho para trabajar en la misma actividad y mantener a sus hijos quienes también se involucran en el trabajo. El comercio de ganado lo aprendió de su padre y expresa que fue su mejor legado pues le ha servido de mucho para mantenerse económicamente.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar 3 vacas y algunos cerdos para comercializarlos. 

Andrés planea seguir trabajando con los créditos de esta institución para lograr todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Andrés is a hard-working man, 50 years old, who is married and has 3 children. 

Andrés works selling cattle and small animals. He has done this work since before meeting his wife, which has served them well to work in the same way and take care of his children, who are also involved in the work. He learned cattle sales from his father and says that it was his greatest legacy since it has served him well to maintain himself economically. 

He needs the loan to purchase 3 cows and some pigs to sell them.

Andrés plans to continue working with the loans from this institution to achieve all his goals.

loans.use: to purchase 3 cows and some pigs to sell them.

loans.name: Jardines De La Luz Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JARDINES DE LA LUZ”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nely ella es conviviente y tiene 38 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de imprenta, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de cosméticos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank named “Jardines de La Luz” (Gardens of the Light), which is located in the District of Cusco, in the Province of Cusco, and the Department of Cusco. 

One of the members is Sra. Nely.  She is 38 years old, in a common-law relationship and has 3 children.  She works in her restaurant business.  She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soups and sauteed beef.  Nely works from 8:00AM until 6:00PM.  She already has eight years in this business and it is going well.  Her dream is to have a restaurant. Nely is asking for a loan to buy products for cooking such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

The members who appear in the attached photos requested permission to have their pictures taken after the meeting for work reasons.  The other members work selling cakes, running a printing business, a grocery store and a business selling cosmetics.

Nely appreciates those who have helped to fulfill her dream in this manner, and she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking such as rice, vegetables and chicken

loans.name: Santos Ramón

texts.es:
Santos de 47 años de edad, está casado y tiene 4 hijos.

Santos se dedica a trabajar como comerciante de especies menores tales como pavos, gallinas y cerdos los cuales destaza y vende en mercados y tiangues, además en navidad sale a vender a otras ciudades, su esposa e hijos son quienes se involucran en el trabajo y le ayudan a Santos, todo con el fin de obtener fondos para salir adelante.


El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar especies menores como pavos, gallinas y cerdos para destazar y vender.

Su sueño en un futuro es seguir trabajando con esta institución para continuar con sus negocios.
texts.en:
Santos is 47 years old, married and has 4 children. He makes a living working as a wholesale trader of smaller species such as turkeys, hens and pigs, which he cuts up and sells at regular and open-air markets. He also travels to other cities to sell them during Christmas. 
Santos’ wife and children help him with work in order to raise funds to get ahead.

The loan will be used to purchase smaller species such as turkeys, hens and pigs to cut up and sell. 
His dream in the future is to keep working with this lending institution in order to continue being in business.

loans.use: purchase smaller species such as turkeys, hens and pigs to cut up and sell.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn works hard to support her family. Gemalyn is married and has a beauty salon business in the Philippines.

She requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional beauty products for her beauty salon.

Gemalyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Gemalyn would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Aleyda Grismery

texts.es:
Aleyda es una joven de 22 años de edad, es una persona muy dedicada a su familia y a la realización de los oficios domésticos, también se dedica a trabajar en una tienda los fines de semana y  a la venta de productos de belleza, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, solo tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad y está estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.

      Ella tiene experiencia de 5 años en la venta de productos de belleza como negocio principal, el cual le genera una ganancia que le sirve para dar un aporte a la economía de su familia, actividad que aprendió de sus hermanas mayores  que se desempeñan como asesoras de ventas de productos de cosmetología.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar productos de belleza ya que en esta temporada los consigue a precio cómodo.

 
Sus metas a futuro son tener un bazar y una sala de belleza que le genere las ganancias suficientes para satisfacer las necesidades de educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Aleyda is a young woman, 22 years of age, who is very dedicated to her family and to domestic tasks. She is also dedicated to working in a store on weekends and, in addition, to selling beauty products. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have just one son, 5 years of age, and he is studying in the community school.

Aleyda has five years of experience selling beauty products as her principal business. This generates earnings that serve to advance the family economy. She learned the activity from her older sisters and they serve as assessors of her sales of cosmetology products.

She needs the loan to buy beauty products since, in this season, they are sold at comfortable prices.

Aleyda's goals for the future are to have a shop and a beauty salon that will generate sufficient earnings to satisfy the educational needs of her son.

loans.use: purchase beauty products, since in this season, they are sold at favorable prices.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 44 years old and a married rice farmer with a grown-up child who lives in the Pursat province of Cambodia. Her husband (also shown in the photo) is 46 years old and is also a rice farmer. Ny and her husband have been cultivating rice for over 30 years. Her child works in a garment factory. Together, they can earn an income of 10 USD per day. 

Ny needs a toilet for the family's use, so she has decided to apply for a loan to buy construction materials needed to build a toilet. With the toilet, she will be able to improve the family’s hygienic living standards. In the future, she hopes to expand her rice farm.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a toilet.

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es:
Maria de 50 años de edad, ha procreado 5 hijos con su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura, todos sus hijos viven aparte pero apoyan a sus padres siempre que pueden. 

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar animales como especies menores, esas son sus principales fuentes de ingresos además del aporte que recibe de sus hijos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales como piedras, arena y cemento para construir un muro en su vivienda, pues se acerca el invierno y quiere sentirse segura. 
	
Ella planea seguir trabajando pues le gusta mantenerse ocupada ya que piensa que  es vital para su salud.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and has 5 children with her husband, who farms for a living. All her children live elsewhere, but they support their parents whenever they can.

María does housework and cares for small animals for a living. These are her main sources of income in addition to the support she gets from her children.

She needs the loan to purchase supplies such as stones, sand, and cement to build a wall in her house. Winter is coming and she wants to feel secure.

She plans to continue working; she likes to keep busy because she considers it essential for her health.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as stones, sand, and cement to build a wall in her house

loans.name: Sin Ku Village Group 1

texts.en:
This community is located Sin Ku Village of Myanmar's Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. Sin Ku Village is an agriculture community. Many villagers are farmers, cultivating rice paddies and planting seasonal vegetables and fruits such as bananas and coconuts. Those without arable land focus on livestock, including ducks and chickens. Some also raise pigs as a form of saving. The community includes five CBO (Community Based Organization) members who are overseeing a group of 15 village customers. The group members will use Proximity's funds to purchase ducks and high quality feed (five day's feed for 100 ducks costs $20).

Pictured above are four CBO members from Sin Ku Group 1 Village, named Daw Mar, Daw San, Daw Pyone and Daw Myint. Daw Mar (first from left in the photo) is 38 years old and married with two children. She and her husband rent five acres of land to plant seasonal vegetables. While her husband takes on the majority of farming duties, Daw Mar is responsible for looking after their 100 ducks. Like other members, Daw Mar will use these funds to purchase ducks, increasing her income from more duck's eggs. Duck eggs are critical to Daw Mar and her family because they offer a steadier, more reliable income stream than their crops.

loans.use: to help the Sin Ku villagers purchase ducks and high quality feed.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is 41 years old, married and has one child in school. 

Analisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Analisa requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Analisa has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Analisa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
Pastor de 61 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes  principios, su familia está formada por su esposa y sus 2 hijos que estudian educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad

Pastor se dedica a la agricultura y  ganadería desde la edad de 18 años, actividad que aprendió junto a sus padres y sus abuelos, motivado por las ganancias que le genera ha decidido continuar ejerciendo estas actividades ya que se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, también su esposa le da un aporte económico a su familia pues ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos y venta de huevos.


El crédito lo necesita para mejorar el techo de su casa y repellar las paredes. 

Sus metas a futuro son las de mejorar instalaciones de la granja de pollos de su esposa, apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, cancelar el crédito y adquirir un nuevo financiamiento para el cuido de ganado.
texts.en:
Pastor is sixty-one years of age and of good character. His family is formed of his wife and two children who are studying in the elementary school of the community.

Pastor has earned his living in agriculture and cattle raising from the age of 18; these are activities he learned from his parents and grandparents. He has decided to continue these activities since they have become his principle source of income. His wife also contributes to the family economy; she works raising chickens and selling eggs.

He needs the loan to improve the roof of his house and plaster the walls. His goals for the future are to make improvements to his wife’s chicken yard, support the education of his children, repay this loan and apply for a new loan to use in the care of his cattle.

loans.use: to improve the roof of his house and to plaster the walls

loans.name: José De La Cruz

texts.es:
José de 60 años de edad, vive con su familia la cual está formada por su esposa y tres hijos, se crio con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura, al paso del tiempo decidió independizarse y formó su familia  y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José tiene una experiencia de 40 años en los trabajos de agricultura y ganadería, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y sus abuelos quienes lo educaron y lo crecieron con amor, y mucho respeto y es lo que lo ha llevado ser una persona de éxito en su vida y ser un ejemplo para su familia. 


El crédito lo necesita para pagar el alquiler de una máquina desgranadora de maíz y una maquina picadora de pasto para ganado, y pagará mano de obra que le ayuda a recoger el maíz,  de esta manera podrá tener sus cosechas seguras y en poco tiempo listas para la venta y para ser almacenadas en sus graneros.

Sus proyecciones que tiene para un futuro son las de apoyar en la educación a sus hijos, también pagar el crédito y adquirir un nuevo crédito para la compra de equipo agrícola.
texts.en:
José is 60 years old. He lives with his family, made up of his wife and 3 children. He grew up with parents who were farmers. As time passed, he decided to move out on his own and form his family. His wife works in their home.

José has 40 years of experience farming and raising livestock, which he learned from his parents and grandparents. They raised him with love and respect, which is what has made him into a successful person and a good example to his family.

He needs the loan to rent a machine to de-kernel corn and a machine to harvest livestock fodder, and to pay workers to help him harvest corn. In this way, he will be able to have harvests that are reliable and quickly ready to be sold and stored in his silos.

His plans for the future are to support his children's education, and also pay back the loan and receive another to buy farming equipment.

loans.use: to rent a machine to de-kernel corn and a machine to harvest livestock fodder, and to pay workers who help him harvest corn

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura is a businesswoman who was born in 1967. She lives in a village and is married. She has 18 years of experience. She has challenges in the sphere of farming. She started her business in 1997. She is a farmer and keeps livestock to sell in the domestic market for an extra price. She is seeking to widen her activity. She also wants to work on the land, planting seeds and corns to gain profit. It is a hard time for her family now. She needs to work hard and obtain additional income to make a better standard of living. She is asking for financial support to buy seeds and corns.

loans.use: To buy seeds and corns

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Cerelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from native-bag making.  Cerelyn is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell for her rice-retailing business.

Cerelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa de 44 años de edad, es una señora muy dedicada al servicio a los demás, cuenta con sus estudios realizados hasta el tercer grado en la escuela, ya que en su niñez vivió con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura, y a ella le correspondía ayudar en las tareas domésticas, hoy en día Rosa vive son su familia que está compuesta por su esposo y 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.

 Rosa se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar, también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos los cuales comercializa cuando están grandes y obtiene buena ganancia. Rosa tiene alrededor de 20 años en esta actividad la cual aprendió de su madre quien también se dedicaba a lo mismo.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar dos cerdas en estado de gestación y otra parte será invertido en compra de electrodomésticos para su casa, de esta forma podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Las metas que ella tiene para un futuro son tener mejores y amplias instalaciones para el cuido de cerdos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old. She is very dedicated to serving others. She went to school until third grade because as a child, she lived with her parents, who worked as farmers, and it fell to her to help with housework. These days, Rosa lives with her family, which is made up of her husband and 4 children, who attend their community's school.

Rosa takes care of tasks around the house, and she also makes money raising pigs and selling them when they are grown. She makes good money. She has about 20 years of experience doing this, a trade she learned from her mother, who also raised pigs.

She needs this loan to buy 2 pregnant sows, and another part of it she will use to buy appliances for her house. In this way, she will be able to improve her and her family's quality of life.

Her future goals are to have better and larger areas to raise pigs, and to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy 2 pregnant sows, and appliances for her house

loans.name: Francisco Joel

texts.es:
Francisco de 30 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad.

Francisco se dedica a la prestación de trasporte en un vehículo que es propiedad de su padre, tiene una experiencia de 10 años en esta actividad, ha decidido continuar ejerciendo estas actividades ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, también su esposa le da un aporte económico a su familia pues pretenden montar una tienda de productos básicos en su comunidad.
