El crédito será utilizado para comprar granos básicos y productos de la canasta básica para la tienda que ha decidido montar con su esposa, también comprará puertas para su casa.

 
Sus metas a futuro son tener una vivienda más equipada y amueblada, adquirir un nuevo préstamo para la compra de un vehículo, y ampliar la tienda.
texts.en:
Francisco is 30 years old, married and has a five year-old son. He earns his living as a driver of a vehicle owned by his father. He has 10 years of experience in this activity and has decided to continue with it since it has become his principal source of income. His wife also contributes economically to the family since they plan to open a general store in their community.

The loan will be used to buy basic grains and basic food items and products for the store he has decided to open with his wife. He will also buy doors for his house.

Francisco’s goals for the future are to have a home that is better equipped and furnished, obtain a loan for the purchase of a vehicle and to enlarge the store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and basic food items and priducts for the store that he has decided to open with his wife; he will also buy doors for his house.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en: Bienvinida earns through retailing various seafood, like shells and seaweed. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC, and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and additional hollow blocks for house repair. She is on her way to repairing her house. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and additional hollow blocks for house repair

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish for her dried fish making.

Gemma has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Eliazar Antonio

texts.es:
Eliazar, de 20 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y su pareja estudió hasta sexto grado, tienen una hija de 2 meses, actualmente viven en la casa de un familiar. 

Eliazar, trabaja en la agricultura, lo aprendió de su padre, el cual toda la vida se ha dedicado a este labor; pero también, trabaja como ayudante de albañil.

Eliazar, solicita el crédito para construir el plantel donde tiene planeado construir su casa.

El sueño principal de Eliazar, es poder terminar su casa para brindarle protección a su hija y a su pareja.
texts.en:
20-year-old Eliazar went to school until second grade. He lives with a partner, who went to school until 6th grade. They have a 2-month-old daughter and currently live in a family member's house.

Eliazar farms for a living. He learned from his father, who has farmed his whole life. But he also works as an assistant bricklayer.

Eliazar is requesting a loan to construct the site where he plans to build his house.

Eliazar's biggest dream is to be able to finish his house so he can provide protection for his daughter and partner.

loans.use: to construct the site where he plans to build his house

loans.name: Luz De Mi Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DE MI VIDA” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eva es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapa, salón de belleza, tienda de barrio, tienda de carnicería, venta de mantas, venta de lencería, venta de utensilios de cocina. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eva es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de su suegra, quien trabaja con el mismo negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide ahorra un poco de dinero e implementar un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina de tejer) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su taller de tejido para la elaboración de sus prendas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución y la atención de la Asesora.

En la imagen se identifica que el cliente no esta presente, él mismo se marcho con urgencia a su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Luz de Mi Vida [Light of my Life] will begin its ninth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Central Focus. It consists of eight members and is lead by a board of directors with Eva as the president. The businesses that the communal association members carry forward are varied, among them are: selling a sausage and potato dish (salchipapas), a beauty salon, a neighborhood store, a butcher, selling blankets, selling lingerie and selling kitchen utensils.

The loan they take out will benefit microenterprises where Eva is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, entering at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business sewing and selling blankets. She discloses that she learned this business many years ago from her mother in law who works in the same business. Over time, she decided to save a bit of money and implement a business independently. 

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital (buying a sewing machine) that she will acquire from the salespeople in the city of El Alto. She will then set it up in the sewing shop to make her apparel. This type of work allows her to generate resources to financially support her family, since she lives with a partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings which the institution offers and the attention from the advisor. This client is not present in the image. She had to leave urgently for her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Grupo Los Globos Group

texts.es:
En Agosto de 2008 se consolidó un grupo llamado “Grupo Los Globos” aunque actualmente solo prevalece una de las integrantes del principio, otras personas se han anexado con la intención de invertir en sus respectivos negocios que son:

Azucena -Abarrotes
Israel, Marcos -Albañilería
Odulia -Comida
Juan, Araceli -Productos para el hogar
Carolina, Herón, Dulce -Ropa
Nieves Guadalupe -Bolsas De Piel
Nieves -Cosméticos Por Catalogo
Cirila, Natalia -Servicio De Taxi
Adriana –Calzado Por Catalogo

Doña Azucena  es una mujer muy trabajadora prueba de ello es que su primer préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de calzado por catálogo y perfumes. Con las ganancias obtenidas apoyó a su esposo con los gastaos de la casa y de la educación de sus dos hijos. Después, invirtió las ganancias y otro préstamo de VisionFund para comenzar a criar puercos y vender la carne. Al paso de dos años, abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa, actividad en la cuál ahora dedica más tiempo. 

Para Azucena es esencial mantener una variedad de productos por lo que necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar arroz, frijol, sopa, aceite, huevos, galletas, refrescos, jugos y algunos productos de limpieza. Hoy en día doña “Chena”, como todos le conocen, también vende productos para el hogar y sigue vendiendo carne bajo pedido. Con parte de las ganancias obtenidas y el sueldo que percibe su esposo como obrero en el ingenio (fábrica de azúcar) han logrado brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos hijos quienes continúan estudiando y por las tardes ayudan a Azucena con los quehaceres de la casa.

“Gracias a Dios y a cada uno de los prestamos que nos han sido otorgados mi tiendita se mantiene estable, pequeña, pero ofreciendo los productos que más buscan los vecinos”.

*La fotografía fue tomada frente a la ventana por donde doña Chena atiende a los clientes de lunes a domingo a partir de las 7:00 am a 8:00 pm, ella viste blusa floreada con anaranjado.
texts.en:
In August of 2008 the group called “Grupo Los Globos” came together. Although today there is only one of the original members left, other members have  joined with the intention of investing in their businesses, which include: 

Azucena - Grocery store
Israel, Marcos -Construction
Odulia - Food sales
Juan, Araceli - Household products
Carolina, Herón, Dulce - Clothing
Nieves Guadalupe - Leather bags
Nieves - Cosmetics through catalogs
Cirila, Natalia - Taxi service
Adriana – Footwear through catalogs

Azucena is a hardworking woman. Proof of this is that she invested her first loan to buy footwear through catalogs and perfumes to sell. With the profits she obtained from this, she helped her husband to pay their household's expenses and sent their two children to school. Later, she invested the earnings plus another loan from VisionFund to start to raise pigs and sell their meat. After two years, she opened a small grocery store in her home, which is the business in which she spends most of her time working. 

For Azucena it is essential to maintain a variety or products, which is why she needs a new loan to buy rice, beans, soup, oil, eggs, crackers, soft drinks, juices, and some cleaning products. Today,  “Chena”, as everyone know her, also sells household products as well as continues to meat that customers order. With part of her earnings and her husbands salary from his job in the sugar factory, they have been able to offer their two children a better quality of life. Their children are still in school and they help Azucena with housework in the afternoon. 

“Thanks to God and each one of the loans that have been offered to us, my store has been stable, small, but offering the products that the neighbors are most looking for."

*The photograph was taken in front of the window where Chena attends to customers Monday through Sunday, from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm. Chena is wearing the orange floral shirt.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, soup, crackers, sweets, soft drinks, juices, bar soap and powder detergent.

loans.name: Enma Catalina

texts.es:
Enma de 55 años de edad, es madre de cinco hijos, no sabe leer ya que no estudio porque ella es la segunda de 9 hermanos y tuvo que cuidar a sus otros hermanos, actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura con su último hijo, ya que los demás viven aparte.

      Enma se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace cinco años desde que participó en una capacitación sobre la crianza de animales, su esposo y su hijo menor se involucran en el trabajo.


Enma necesita el crédito para construir un lavadero para ropa y una pila por lo que comprará 10 bolsas de cemento, 12 láminas para el techo y los polines para darles una mayor duración y con ello estará cubriendo su necesidad.
 

El deseo de Enma es ver su casa como siempre lo ha soñado.
texts.en:
Enma is 55 years old and she is the mother of five children. She doesn't know how to read as she didn't go to school because she is the second of nine children and she had to care for her other siblings. She is currently married and her husband makes a living in agriculture with her youngest son, as her other children live elsewhere.

Enma makes a living by raising pigs. She has had this business for five years since she participated in a training on raising animals. Her husband and her youngest son are involved in the work.

Enma needs the loan to build a washroom and sink for clothing, for which she will buy ten bags of cement, twelve tiles for the roof and the beams to make them last longer. With this she will cover what she needs.
 
Enma's desire is to see her house as she's always dreamed.

loans.use: to build a washroom and sink for clothing, for which she will buy ten bags of cement, twelve tiles for the roof and beams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables for her food stall

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ana de 31 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, está acompañada y tiene dos hijos que estudiarán este año, su compañero de vida trabaja como agente de seguridad en una empresa privada.

      Ana se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que realiza desde hace siete años y trabaja tres veces por semana debido a que no tiene quien le haga el oficio en la casa, el negocio lo aprendió por que otra hermana le enseñó a comprar y a vender la ropa, Ana camina seis kilómetros cuando sale a vender a las comunidades.


Ella necesita este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción pues desea hacer un dormitorio más para sus hijos, quiere darles privacidad que es lo que les hace falta, es así que estará satisfaciendo su necesidad.

Su sueño es ver crecer a sus hijos pues para ellos es que trabaja para generar las condiciones que le permitan estudiar y cuando sean grandes puedan asistir a la universidad.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old and studied up to the ninth grade. She is in a relationship and has two children who will be in school this year. Her life partner works as a security guard at a private company.

Ana makes a living by selling clothing. She has had this business for seven years and works three times a week because she doesn't have anyone else to take care of her home. She learned this business because another sister taught her to buy and sell clothing. Ana walks six kilometers when she goes out to sell in the communities.

She needs this loan to buy construction materials as she wants to build another bedroom for her children. She wants to given them the privacy they are lacking; she will be satisfying their needs in this way.

Her dream is to see her children grow, as they are the reason she works to generate the conditions that will allow them to study and attend the university when they are grown up.

loans.use: to buy construction materials as she wants to build another bedroom for her children

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 45 years old, married and has three children. She is running a store to supplement her spouse's income derived from farming. She patiently offers good products and services in order to gain more profits. She is now asking for PHP 13,000 to buy canned goods, milk, sugar and noodles to sell. She will continuously offer more goods. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, sugar and noodles to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 27 years old and married with three children, who are all attending school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
Bahrom is a handsome man. He was born in a remote district. He is a student. He studies at Second Higher Education. He graduated well with his first degree. He is an educated, hardworking, punctual and responsive man. He is married. He is a family man. 

Now he is a second year student. He studies law. He is well known among students and friends. Unfortunately they do not have enough money to pay for the second education. 

Bahrom has requested financial support to pay tuition for university.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Buhava

texts.en: Buhava is a liberal woman. She was born in a rural area. She is living in a village. She is married. She has three children. She has been trading for about fifteen years. She buys and sells rice. She exports rice from Kyrgyzstan and sells at her domestic market. She is well known in the market for rice. She wants to enlarge her business. She is an active, hardworking and responsive person. She is planning to buy rice to expand her business. She is asking for financial support to buy rice.

loans.use: to buy rice to expand her business.

loans.name: Ortik

texts.en: Ortik is a liberal man. He was born in 1962. He was born in a family of workers. He lives in a remote district. He is married. He has two children. His wife is a seamstress. He has been doing business for about thirty years. Ortik is a taxi driver. He has a lot of satisfied clients. During the period of serving people he got good experience. Year by year the dream of feeding his family became stronger. Now he is planning to enlarge his activity. He wants to buy an automobile. He is requesting financial support to buy a new automobile to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To buy a new automobile

loans.name: Ma. Sanny

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Ma. Sanny works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 23,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Ma. Sanny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.en: Ibodat is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1986. She is living in a region. She is married. She has three children. Her husband is a builder. Ibodat is a hardworking, generous, liberal and hospitable person. She is a farmer. She has been keeping livestock for about ten years already. She buys and sells honored cattle. She has satisfied customers. Ibodat had a dream to buy a car. It was hard to rent a car to take cattle into the domestic market for selling. She calculated that her expenses are rising in amount every quarter. Ibodat is planning to buy a car. She is asking for financial support to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Wilah Jane

texts.en:
Wilah Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Wilah Jane has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is a married woman; she has three children, all of whom attend school. Floriana lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Floriana has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Yunusbek

texts.en: Yunusbek is a hardworking man. He was born in 1966. He is living in a remote district. He is married and has three children. His wife is working by planting agricultural products. He is a farmer. Yunusbek has been doing a farming business for 15 years. He keeps feeds and sells honored cattle. He has great experience in this sphere. Yunusbek has three horned cattle now. He is planning to widen his activity. He wants to buy additional horned cattle to gain a profit. He is seeking financial support to buy horned cattle.

loans.use: To buy horned cattle

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia, 62, is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Emilia joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her sari-sari store. As it helps the family survive, she never gets tired of tending her little store. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising sales daily. 

Emilia continues to run the store well, even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with the support of her family, they will sustain and beat the competition. 

Emilia is now trying to expand her resources, and she has decided to engage in barbecue chicken and pork vending for added income. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy merchandise for her store and pay for inventories of chicken and pork meat for her new business to continue providing for her home. 

With her extra income, she wishes to live a happy and comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase the inventory of her store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional medicine products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will lend her 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to buy additional medicine and grocery products, which she also sells. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit. This will result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Norma wants to succeed in her future plans and have financial freedom. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional medicine products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en:
Joelita is 44 years old and a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Joelita has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Joelita requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

Joelita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Joelita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
José de 50 años de edad, es un jornalero que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a que donde vivía antes cuando estaba pequeño no habían escuelas, hoy en día está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus hijos todos son mayores de edad y viven aparte pues cada uno tiene su familia, solo vive con su esposa y él trabaja para ella pues está mal de salud.


José se dedica a la agricultura y a cuidar cuatro vacas que tiene desde hace seis años, las crías le han servido para venderlas y cubrir algunos gastos de su esposa, el lugar donde trabaja está a 500 metros de su casa, no tiene horario de trabajo ya que lo hace desde que amanece hasta anochecer.

Él necesita el crédito para alquilar una parcela de seis hectáreas de terreno para sembrar y  dejar para pasto de los animales en el invierno.

Su sueño es comprar una parcela que sea propia para no depender de otros y poder heredar algo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 50 years old. He is a day laborer who didn’t have the opportunity to study because the in place where he lived when he was young there weren’t any schools. He now lives with his partner and his wife works in the home. Their children are grown and live apart, each with their family. He lives alone with his wife and only he is working because she is in poor health.

José works in agriculture and cares for four cows that he has had for six years. He has use sales of their offspring to cover some expenses for his wife. The place where he works is 500 meters from his house. He doesn’t have a specific work schedule because he works from the time he gets up until nightfall. 

He needs the loan to rent a six-hectare piece of land so he can plant it and let his cows graze on it in the winter. 

His dream is to buy a piece of land that would be his so he wouldn’t have to rely on others, and also so he could leave something to his children.

loans.use: to rent a six-hectare piece of land so he can plant it and let his cows graze on it in the winter.

loans.name: Saúl Antonio

texts.es:
Saúl de 24 años de edad, es un joven que ya terminó los estudios de bachillerato, está soltero y vive con sus padres.


      Saúl se dedica a brindar transporte a diversos lugares del país, el vehículo es de su padre pero le está sirviendo como medio de trabajo para aportar dinero al hogar.



Él solicita el crédito para reparar el vehículo ya que el motor necesita ajustes, es muy importante este crédito para Saúl ya que el vehículo es su principal fuente de ingresos.


Su sueño es tener su vehículo propio para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Saúl is 24 years old. He is a young man who has finished high school. He is single and lives with his parents.

Saúl provides transportation to various areas of the country. The vehicle belongs to his father, but he is using it for transport so he can bring money home.

He is requesting the loan to repair the vehicle because the motor needs some adjustments. This loan is very important to Saúl because the vehicle is his main source of income.

His dream is to have his own vehicle so he can continue working.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle because the motor needs some adjustments.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva, de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación básica, está casada y su esposo trabaja como agricultor. 

Eva, antes trabajaba solo en los oficios domestico del hogar, en el año 2012 comenzó a trabajar vendiendo tortillas, lo cual le ha permitido obtener ingresos para los gastos de la familia.

Eva, solicita el crédito para compra 5 sacos de maíz, ya que es temporada recoger la cosecha y hay maíz en abundancia y se consigue a buen precio. 

El sueño principal de Eva, es brindarles la mejor educación a sus hijos y que se conviertan en profesionales.
texts.en:
Eva is 40 years old. She studied through third grade in her basic education. She is married and her husband works as a farmer.

Eva used to work only in the home. In 2012 she started to work selling tortillas, which has allowed her to have more income for her family’s expenses. 

Eva is requesting the loan to buy 5 sacks of corn, since right now is the harvest season and there is a lot of corn, so she can get a good price.

Eva’s biggest dream is to provide the best education for her children and for them to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of corn.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase various office and school supplies needed in her School supplies store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy additional quantities of office/school supplies such as bond paper, ink, pens, staplers, fasteners and other supplies needed at her store. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Ma. Cecilia dreams of having a branch in an area near a public school. She aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for office and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 46 years old, married and has three children. She is managing a retail store for income. She diligently sells grocery items to the people in her village. She hopes to increase her profits but has insufficient funds to buy additional goods to sell so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy sardines, noodles, soap, shampoo and eggs to sell. With these additional goods to sell, she will be able to meet all her customers' demands and increase her profits too.

loans.use: to buy sardines, noodles, soap, shampoo and eggs to sell

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.en: Abdusattor is a goal-oriented man. He was born in 1954 and he is living in a rural area. He is married. He has a great experience and outlook in the sphere of serving people. He has his own traditional restaurant. He was a teacher for about 30 years in a secondary school. For about 17 years, Abdusattor has been in the restaurant business. He serves basically men in his restaurant. He has a variety of drinks and meals in his everyday menu. He is planning to widen his activity. He needs to buy grocery products for the restaurant. Abdusattor requested financial support to buy these grocery products.

loans.use: To buy grocery products for his restaurant

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 62 years old, married and has nine children.

Adelaida is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable garden.

Adelaida has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Germán Arnoldo

texts.es:
Germán de 41 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de nivel académico, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están en la escuela, y son 3 personas las que dependen de Germán.

Él se dedica a  prestar servicio de militar desde hace 14 años, este trabajo lo aprendió desde joven que ingresó al cuartel, este trabajo le queda a 1 hora de distancia en bus, y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la agricultura.


Germán necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca y para pagar mano de obra para sacar el maíz.

Él sueña con que Dios lo cuide en su trabajo para seguir apoyando a su familia, pues le gustaría que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Germán is 41 years old. He studied through sixth grade. He is married and his wife works in the home. He has 2 children, who are in school, and a total of 3 people are economically dependent on Germán.

He has worked for the military for 14 years. He learned this job from the time he entered the service. His job is 1 hour away by bus, and in his free time he works in agriculture.

Germán needs the loan to buy a cow and to pay for labor to harvest the corn.

His dream is that God will guide him so he can continue providing for his family, because he would like for his children to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy a cow and to pay for labor to harvest his corn.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 46 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  Currently, Elvie is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Elvie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, de 38 años de edad, no estudio debido a que desde pequeño comenzó a dedicarse al trabajo, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja como empleada doméstica, ayudando así para los ingresos de la familia, su hijo mayor aporta también a los ingresos.

Dolores, trabaja como pescador, actividad que aprendió de su padre, ya que él era pescador. 
Además, trabaja también en la agricultura sembrando 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, trabaja de 6:00 a.m a 12:00 m.d y en la pesca por la noche.

Dolores, solicita el crédito para comprar 2,000 tejas y lamina, para reparar la casa.
El sueño principal de Dolores, es tener su propia casa para tener una estabilidad familiar y seguir trabajando para que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Dolores is 38 years old. He didn’t go to school because he started worked when he was young. He lives with his life partner and she works as a domestic worker so she can help with the family income. His oldest son also helps out with income.

Dolores works as a fisherman, which he learned to do from his father, who was also a fisherman. He also works in agriculture, planting 7,000 square meters of corn. He works from 6:00am until 12:00pm and fishes at night.

Dolores is requesting the loan to buy 2,000 roof tiles so he can repair his house. 

His biggest dream is buy his own house so he can have stability for his family and continue working so his family won’t lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy 2,000 roof tiles so he can repair his house.

loans.name: Yesika Yamileth

texts.es:
Yésika de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta 6to grado de nivel académico, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijos los cuales uno de ellos está en la escuela y son los únicos que dependen de ella.

Yésika se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 6 años,  en este momento está vendiendo una verdura llamada “pito” pues es la época en que sale esta cosecha, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre, Yésika vende en el mercado de lunes a domingo y viaja en bus aproximadamente 45 minutos.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más “pito” y frutas, de esta forma podrá tener abastecida su venta en el mercado.
 
Su sueño es seguir trabajando duro para darles a sus hijos lo necesario.
texts.en:
Yésika is 28 years old. She studied through 6th grade. She lives with her partner, who works in agriculture. They have two children, one of whom is in school. They are the only people who are economically dependent on her.

Yésika has been selling fruits and vegetables for 6 years. Right now she is selling a vegetable called coral bean flowers, because this is the season when it is harvested. She learned this work from her mother. Yésika works in the market from Monday to Sunday and travels approximately 45 minutes by bus. 

She needs the loan to buy more coral bean flowers and fruits. In this way she will be able to have her stand in the market well stocked.

Her dream is to continue working hard in order to give her children the necessities.

loans.use: to buy more coral bean flowers and fruits so she will be able to have her stand in the market well stocked.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Erick, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 23-year-old dairy farmer. 

As the key breadwinner for his parents, he farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nandihills in the famous Rift valley region of Kenya. For the past five years, he has been practicing mixed farming. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs and crop selling. He also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income he earns through farming. Erick passionately loves dairy farming. The biggest challenge he faces is feeding his cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. He is seeking a loan to buy another quality breed of dairy cow. 

Erick intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will produce between 15 and 25 liters of milk a day. The selling price for milk is 40 KES per liter, and with this loan, he would make a cool US $11 per day. Before Erick joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, he considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have any future promise for income generation. After training, Erick now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a rather less rough way into the millionaires' club. 

With the loan, Erick will increase his income from milk selling and his cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows, and through this loan, Erick will achieve this. An increase in income will allow Erick to improve his living conditions and secure the future of his children. His dream is to continue improving his dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Erick fears that his dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide its reliable market channel, credit facility, and services that he requires to grow his dairy enterprise.

Support this Kenyan entrepreneur with a $25 loan!

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Tito Jonas

texts.es: Tito de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, desde hace varios años se dedica a la  crianza de ganado lechero (producción y venta de leche)  en la zona donde reside, tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de concentrado y una vaca lechera que le permita crecer en el negocio, así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Tito is 55 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He has been raising milk cows for several years (milk production and sales). In the area where he lives he has a very good clientele because he has earned his customers’ trust. He offers quality and good prices on his products. 

He has decided to invest in the care of his cattle, since his business depends on them. He has requested a loan to buy concentrated feed and a milk cow, which will allow him to grow the business and have better income.

loans.use: buy concentrated feed and a milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as: chicken, rice, beef, vegetables, fruits, etc. at wholesale price.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is thankful that he was previously granted a 8,000 PHP loan which he used to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed on his farm. He is so glad that through his earnings he is able to support his family and meet their daily basic needs.

He would now like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan which he will use to buy more fertilizer and farm inputs for a more productive pineapple harvest on his farm.  It will definitely help cover his family’s daily needs and for help with his children’s education. He is thanking God, and you, in advance for the financial help that will be given him. 

Dominador dreams that his farm will grow and flourish and that he will have a happy and prosperous life with his family. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and it is a place he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and farm fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beef and chicken so she can prepare her foods.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra, aged 57, is a hard-working mother from Oroquieta. She is a businesswoman who makes copra for which she buys whole coconuts. 

Alejandra has signed her membership with the cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to insurances and credit. She has applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Alejandra hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 46 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with children who are now adults and at school age. Lolita earns income from her little sari-sari (variety) store and her barbecue vending business. She has already been engaged in this business for two years. Lolita earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity, an amount which is so helpful in supporting her basic needs. 

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. She has requested a loan to pay for her son's annual medical examinations which he is required to have as a maritime student. In the future, Lolita hopes to expand her sari-sari store and her barbecue vending business.

loans.use: To pay for her son's annual medical examinations which he is required to have as a maritime student

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines for the past six years.

Meliza has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en:
Komiljon is a hard-working man who was born in 1988. He is a composed, anxious and wise person. who lives in a rural area. Komiljon is married with a baby and his wife is the housekeeper. He has responsibilities to feed his family. 

Komiljon has had a driving licence for more than six years. He participated in three days' training where he was taught how to be an entrepreneur. He decided to be a businessman and is planning to buy a car for his shuttle service. Komiljon needs financial support to start up his business.

loans.use: To buy a car for his shuttle service

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita has a hobby of listening to music and she also loves to sing. She keeps herself busy to sufficiently provide for her family. Tita came up with the idea to set up a "Videoke" house; not only is she enjoying operating the business but she also earns a meagre income to support her family, and especially her husband's health needs. 

Tita grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with meeting her financing needs so she can buy another "Videoke" machine unit. Tita will use the added income to help her grandchildren with their school expenses.

In the future, Tita wishes to own more "Videoke" units and to put them in every store or resort so she can also help others to earn income.

loans.use: to buy another "Videoke" machine unit for added income

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 52 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She is married and has two children, both of whom are now adults.

To earn a living, Rosario has been managing her little sari-sari (general) store for eight years already. She earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. She has requested a loan to buy additional stocks of groceries and other consumable products for her store.

Rosario has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, she hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a hard-working and industrious father, who is known in his neighborhood for being a "tuba" (coconut wine) gatherer. Everyday he sells and delivers his "tuba" in the public market and earns 400 Philippines pesos (PHP) daily. This is how he has supported his family and five children in their education for 20 years. He became a member of PMPC and appreciates the various programs and services that the coop offers. He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house. Thus, he has applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy plywood, nails, and wood to build a safe and comfortable living space. He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters to him that he has been given priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). He is thankful that all his financing needs have been supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to buy plywood, nails, and wood to build a safe and comfortable living space

loans.name: Telma Alicia

texts.es: Doña Telma de 54 años de edad es viuda y vive en casa propia con su hija quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica desde hace 7 años a la venta de productos de uso personal, vende sus productos por mayor y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: 54-year-old Telma is a widow. She lives in her own home with her daughter who works and helps her financially. For the last 7 years, she has run a business selling personal care products in bulk and she now has regular clients. Her income enables her to cover some of her household expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy perfume, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc. in bulk so that she can continue working and boost her income.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants etc. in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Ikih

texts.en:
Ikih is 46 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Ikih works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like shampoo, sugar, canned goods and eggs.

Ikih has been running her shop for eight years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is married with three children, two of whom attend school while the other is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a cosmetics shop, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) that she is requesting, she wants to buy perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions for her shop

loans.name: Shes Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres alegres (Ángela, Esmy Yadira y Marisol). Las tres tienen establecida sus respectivas pulperías donde venden productos básicos. La más pequeña es Ángela, ella vende frijoles cocidos, chiverías y granos básicos.  Ya han trabajado su primer préstamo con financiamiento de KIVA, con el cual lograron incrementar un poco el inventario de los productos que ofertan, esto les ha permitido también mejorar más sus ingresos y han podido solventar necesidades básicas de sus hijos. 

Marisol: Es integrante del grupo solidario SHES, es una mujer amable, tiene 33 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar y en la educación de sus hijos, desde hace 8 años estableció una pequeña pulpería, en un anexo de madera que construyo en su vivienda. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para continuar incrementando la cantidad de productos que vende en su pulpería, para continuar mejorando más sus ingresos. Su sueño es tener un negocio grande y próspero.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 3 happy women, Ángela, Esmy Yadira and Marisol.  They have each established their own small general store where they sell basic products.  The smallest one is Angela, who she sells cooked beans, snacks, and basic grains.  The women have already finished their first loan from Kiva, which allowed them to increase the inventory of the products that they offer by a little bit and to improve their incomes even more.  They have also been able to take care of their children's basic necessities.

Marisol is a member of the SHES group.  She is a friendly 33-year-old woman who is married with 4 adolescent children who are in primary and secondary school.  With the intention of paying for household expenses and her children's education, she established a small general store 8 years ago in a wooden annex that she constructed on her home.  She is requesting her second loan to continue increasing the quantity of products that she sells at her general store so that she can continue to improve her income.  Her dream is to have a big and prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, basic grains, toilet paper, and instant soaps, among other products

loans.name: Gitana Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres jóvenes emprendedores (Mirna Yajaira, Sergio y Alix Karriel) de la ciudad de Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Mirna vende ropa usada en el corredor de su casa, Sergio tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa y Alex vende madera aserrada. Es un grupo solidario nuevo que se organizó hace unos meses.  

Mirna Yajaira: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer afable, con cualidades de líder, que motiva  a sus compañeros  para que se mantengan optimistas. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando su segundo financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca mixta de mejor calidad y vender al menudeo a precios accesibles en Bilwi. Su sueño es verse convertida en una empresaria exitosa y prospera, con suficiente capital para  para establecer una tienda grande de ropa nueva y calzado.
texts.en: This solidarity group is made up of three young entrepreneurs (Mirna Yajaira, Sergio and Alix Karriel) from the city of Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Mirna sells second-hand clothing in the hallway of her home, Sergio has a small grocery shop in his home and Alex sells sawn wood. It is a new solidarity group which was set up only a few months ago. Mirna Yajaira is the group's coordinator; she is a friendly woman with leadership qualities who motivates her colleagues and helps them remain optimistic. She has been selling second-hand clothing for 4 years and this enables her to generate an income and contribute to the household expenses. She is applying for her second loan to buy a mixed bale of better quality clothing in Managua and sell it retail in Bilwi for affordable prices. Her dream is to become a successful and prosperous businesswoman , with enough capital to set up a shop selling new clothing and footwear.

loans.use: to buy a mixed bale of better quality in Managua

loans.name: La Concepcion Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo Solidario Concepción, está  integrado por un hombre y dos mujeres emprendedoras (Andrés, Lucrecia Lucia y María Auxiliadora), viven en la comunidad kilómetro 43, de Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas; se organizaron en grupo solidario para poder accesar a financiamiento mediante la metodología grupal, para mejorar sus pequeños negocios, que les permita a la vez mejorar sus ingresos y poder resolver necesidades básicas de su núcleo familiar y  asegurar la educación de sus hijos. 

Andrés: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, es un hombre con  cualidades de líder, tiene 35 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Debido a la falta de un empleo formal, desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda, con el propósito de generar ingresos y poder asumir los gastos del hogar y asegurar la alimentación de sus hijos. Está solicitando su primer préstamo para comprar más productos para su pulpería. Su sueño es llegar a  tener una tienda grande y próspera.
texts.en:
The La Concepción solidarity group is made up of an enterprising man and two enterprising women (Andrés, Lucrecia Lucia and María Auxiliadora). They lives in the Kilometer 43 community of Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. They formed the solidarity group to be able to access funding through the group method, to improve their small businesses, which permits them to improve their income and at the same time be able to solve basic needs of their nuclear families and assure their children's education.

Andrés is the coordinator of the solidarity group. He is a man with leadership qualities. He is 35 years old, married, and has two young children. Due to the lack of formal employment, 3 years ago he established a small grocery store in the outdoor covered space of his house with the purpose of generating income and being able to cover the household expenses and assuring that his children eat.  He is applying for his first loan to purchase more products for his grocery store. His dream is to have a large and prosperous store.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, basic grains, powdered milk, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al transporte de personas en su vehículo desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young man, whose face has been pixelated because he is 28 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has worked transporting people in his vehicle for some years. He has many customers who prefer him due to his responsibility when he drives. With what he earns from his work, he manages to pay the expenses that come up in his household. He lives in his own house with his mother. He is applying for a loan to purchase tires and do maintenance to his vehicle since it is his only source of work and to be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tires and do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es: Juan de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de sorbetes, paletas, etc. con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, Juan quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro de contención en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cementos, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que el y su esposa puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: 53-year-old Juan lives with his wife in their own home. He has sold ice lollies and ice creams for 15 years and his income enables him to cover some of the household expenses. Juan wants to improve his home by building a retaining wall in the place shown on the photo, but he cannot afford it on what he earns from his sales. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and to pay labourers so that he and his wife can have a safer and more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and to pay labourers

loans.name: Kimyann

texts.en:
Kimyann is 33 years old, a married factory worker with a young child, who lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory for over four years, making approximately $5 a day. Her husband is a 33-year-old driver, earning about $5 a day. 

Kimyann has decided to request a loan, and she will use it to buy construction materials to build a bathroom with a toilet.  This loan will help her and her family have a proper bathroom for daily use. 

For her future plans, she is going to stop working in the factory to run a grocery at home, and support her only child to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bathroom with a toilet

loans.name: Abroriddin

texts.en:
Abroriddin is a responsible man. He was born in a rural area. He lives in a remote district. He is married, and he has three children. His wife is a housekeeper. For more than ten years, he has been working as a builder. He serves customers in his area, nearby villages and rural areas. He is famous and well known among builders. He is very busy man. 

Abroriddin is a bright, composed and efficient person. He has additional income from doing a business of viticulture. He plants, and sells grapes in a  domestic market. He is planning to improve his planting with fertilizer. 

He is needing financial support to buy fertilizer, corn, and natural manure.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, corn, and natural manure

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, who accessed an 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she used for spare parts and accessories for her motorized tricycle taxi. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Marilyn would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be extended to her.

Marilyn hopes to buy another tricycle to improve her business. She dreams of prosperity and good health for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories and the maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Pedernales cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito mujeres emprendedoras, se lo conoce por estar rodeada de playas que bañan la costa, la gente se dedica a la pesca y a trabajar en camaroneras.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 37 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos de los mismos que estudian en una escuela local. El marido es pescador y tiene una moto taxi en la cual realiza turismo.
Doña María es una mujer  muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante  junto a su familia, ella tiene un restaurante en un local que arrienda, ella prepara desayunos,  almuerzos y meriendas pero solo los fines de semana y feriados  ya que es cuando más personas acuden hasta el lugar, allí en estos días sus hijos y su marido le ayudan, ella también elabora deliciosos bolos y helados de distintos sabores  con los cuales tiene un ingreso extra que les sirve para salir adelante, ya son 3 años que tiene con este negocio, con el cual se gana lo suyo que le sirve para ir arreglando su hogar.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para la elaboración de sus platos. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la seriedad del grupo. Sus sueños son tener un local propio para su  restaurante.
texts.en:
In the city of Pedernales, the Mujeres Emprendedoras communal bank group meets every two weeks. This place is known as being surrounded by beaches that wash the coast, the people work in fishing and working on shrimp boats.

María lives in this place. She is 37 years old, in a common-law marriage, and in this relationship has two children who go to a local school. Her husband is a fisherman and has a motorcycle taxi in which he works in tourism. 

María is a very determined woman who likes to work to be able to get ahead with her family. She has a restaurant in a space she rents. She makes breakfasts, lunches, and snacks but only on the weekends and holidays, since that is when more people come to the place. There, on those days, her children and her husband help her. She also makes delicious bolos [frozen popsicle-like sweets] and ice creams of different flavors, with which she has extra income that helps her get ahead. She has had this business for three years, with which she earns her own income which helps her to take care of her household.

This loan will be used to purchase vegetables to make her dishes. She has been in the communal bank for three years and she likes it because of the group's seriousness. Her dream is to have her own retail space for her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 50 posts and 2 quintales of wire to fence around his home.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Smallholder farmers in Kenya, like David (pictured), continue to languish in poverty due to the unwilling nature of formal financial institutions to set up shops in remote areas. They say the rural population is unevenly dispersed and the farmers regularly make low incomes. 

Supported by Kiva, Juhudi Kilimo penetrates remote regions to finance agricultural assets and farm inputs to improve productivity and profitability of rural enterprises. 

In this case, David is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase animal feed. Through this loan, his cows will be able to improve their milk productivity which will boast his income flow. Income from this venture will help David repay the loan, take care of his wife, and take his five children to school. David's family will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for their kind hearts, to spare their needs, and help David raise money to move his family forward. 

All that David waits for is your kindness.

Invest in a Kenyan entrepreneur with big dreams to succeed.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Emprendedoras, son  de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, y comentan que sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres para que puedan ellas aumentar sus ingresos.
La Sra. Mariana es la presidenta del grupo, ella es Cocinera, desea aumentar la variedad de sus comidas y de esa manera ayudar a su familia, comenta que le va muy bien en su trabajo y que con ello da a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
texts.en:
The group is called 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Enterprising Women), they come from San Ignacio city. They all help one another and are very close. They work together on activities and they say that they feel the support of the women's committee program to enable them to increase their incomes. 

Mariana is the president of the group. She is a cook and wants to expand the variety of her dishes and this way help her family. She mentions that work is going very well, allowing her to give her family all she couldn't have. She is a selfless and hard-working woman.

She requests this loan to buy assorted ingredients for her dishes, such as vegetables, meat, condiments and others, so she can continue to delight her customers with the delicacies she makes.

loans.use: to buy assorted ingredients such as vegetables, meat, condiments and others to make her dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 4 años a la siembra de granos básicos, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercado que se encuentran cerca de su casa,  el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para realizar sus siembras y asi poder tener mejores cosechas para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This young 26-year-old's face has been blurred because he lives in a high-risk zone.  He has made a living for 4 years growing basic grains and selling his products at the different markets near his home.  He lives in his own home with his extended family, and he is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, and herbicides so that he can improve the plot of land shown in the photo so that he can plant it and obtain a better harvest for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, and herbicides and improve the land

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en:
Marietha sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies that she needed in her store. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business more if lenders let her take out a new loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). This new loan will go to additional groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products that she sells. Simultaneously, she will be able to sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Marietha wants her family to always be healthy and free from any form of sickness. She aims to grow her business too. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
This is Alejandra. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and pay their expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will lend her an amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go towards an additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed on her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also mean her business can become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Alejandra wants to make improvements to their house and store. She dreams that her family will always be completely happy. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy raw materials and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional materials like fabric and thread, which she uses in making rugs that she sells. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Joy wants to save for the future of her family. She also aims to maintain an increasing profit from her business, and expanding soon. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabrics, etc. for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to pay for the renewal of the franchise agreement/permit so she can continue her tricycle business. Her earnings helped cover their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Now she would like to apply for a 16,000 PHP loan for the continuous maintenance of her tricycle unit. It is important that her unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service and steady income. Her income from her transportation business helps to sustain their daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Eufemia plans to buy another tricycle to improve her business and be able to save for her old age. She prays for good health and prosperity for all her married children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marites works hard to support her family. She has a food production business in the Philippines.  

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like peanuts, sugar, cooking oil, etc for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like peanuts, sugar, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like sugar, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like sugar, milk, coffee, eggs, etc

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 51-year-old married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marites has a clothing sales business in Calatrava, the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of clothing to sell.

Marites has been in this business for two years and in the future she would like to build and expand it further.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married with two children, one of whom attends school, while the other one is still young. They live at rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga (women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan of 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s

loans.name: Benglam Group

texts.en:
Deihkim, a 50-year-old woman who possess leadership qualities, is the representative of the group "Benglam." She lives in the hills in the northeastern part of India. Deihkim is the featured member of the group pictured with her hand raised. 

Most people in her village engage in daily wage earning and weaving. Deihkim runs a petty shop to support her family. She sometimes sells vegetables from door to door and involves herself in weaving to earn enough income. This enables her to support her household expenses and her children’s educational costs. She is very productive and spends her time wisely for the betterment of her family. 

The petty shop is rented and she has to pay rent regularly. She now aspires to concentrate on her petty shop by selling more items to increase her earnings. With the Kiva loan, she will purchase more items for her shop to expand it. She expresses her sincere thanks to the lenders for helping her to achieve her dream. The other group members are all striving to achieve their financial goals through the Kiva loan.

loans.use: To purchase stock of sweets, chocolates, biscuits, sugar, edible oil, and grains to sell in her grocery shop.

loans.name: Mwadele

texts.en:
Mwadele is a married woman with three children,  two of whom attend school and the other one is still young. They live at a rental house that  has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwadele has operated a clothes selling business, where she sells at the market to town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan  of 40,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 43 years old, married and has seven children, three of whom are in school.

Monaliza is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in Calatrava, the Philippines. She has requested a 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Monaliza has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand it.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Floriselda

texts.es: Floriselda de 40 años de edad termino su educación secundaria de forma satisfactoria consiguiendo graduarse como maestra de educación primaria, está acompañada y de su relación procreo 4 hijos quienes viven con ella y junto a su padre se encargan de dar a sus cultivos de café el mantenimiento, cuidado y protección que es necesario. Floriselda desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura aprendiendo dicha actividad de sus padres quienes también se esforzaron por dar a su familia una buena enseñanza, educación y principios para salir adelante de forma honrada. El lugar donde siembra su pareja el café está ubicado a pocos metros de distancia de su casa de habitacion al cual se desplazan caminando en compañía de sus hijos. Floriselda se levanta temprano por la mañana para poder atender a sus hijos quienes asisten a la escuela y a su conyugue quien se desplaza al campo elaborando sus alimentos y los diferentes quehaceres en el hogar para después desplazarse al campo y apoyar. Floriselda está solicitando el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, plaguicida entre otros ya que de esa manera podrá dar a sus cultivos de café un excelente mantenimiento teniendo sobre los mismos un excelente rendimiento e ingresos.
texts.en: 40-year-old Floriselda successfully completed her secondary education and qualified as a primary teacher. She is married with 4 children who live with her and who, along with their father, all provide the necessary maintenance, care and protection which the coffee crops need. Floriselda has worked in agriculture for a number of years, learning her trade from her parents who also work hard to give their family a good education and teach them what they need to know to lead a decent life. The place where her husband grows the coffee is a few metres from their home and they walk there along with their children.
