Floriselda gets up early each morning to get her children ready for school, prepare food for her husband who goes off to the fields and do the housework before going to the fields herself to help out. Floriselda is applying for the loan to buy fertiliser, manure and weed-killer among other things so she can tend the coffee crops in the best way possible and achieve an excellent yield and income.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertiliser and weed-killer  for her coffee crops

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: Analie is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is engaged in retail sales of rice and dried fish. This has been the source of her income for the past four years now. Analie is asking to take a loan to buy more rice and dried fish to sell. A loan will help her improve her business’ productivity and sustainability.

loans.use: to buy more rice and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Kijiwe Pesa Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her mid 30s, is married and has three children who are still at school.  

She has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2000. She works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Asha's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the items at her genge (grocery stall) because before the loan the genge was just too small, but now her table is full of most of the items the customers want. 

She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the missing fruits and vegetables for her genge and to buy more of the fast-moving items. She dreams of increasing her business.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "Kijiwe Pesa," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing fruits and vegetables for her genge and to buy more of the fast-moving items.

loans.name: Mark Jun

texts.en: Mark Jun is twenty-one years old and single. He has signed up as a member with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital it extends to a small-time loaner like him. Mark Jun is able to turn the tide in his favor and has made good sales recently. He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, he availed a loan to restock his store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, he hopes to save enough for his future family.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities and other consumable items for his store

loans.name: Alili

texts.en: Alili is driven by determination and energy in her retailing business. At the age of sixty and married in Aloran, she runs a store to provide for the basic necessities of their family. Every day she patiently tends to her store until 10 o'clock in the evening. Alili wants to expand her business, so she recently signed up for membership in Paglaum MPC to access insurance and financial assistance. Now, she has borrowed a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her needs and those of the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been in this business for nine years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 44 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.

Nora has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from hardware.

Nora aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. 

Rosalie is married and has a pharmacy business in the Philippines. Rosalie has been in this business for four years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of medicine to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of medicine to sell.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es un hombre casado de 51 años de edad vive junto a sus cinco hijos y su esposa  en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.

José es un padre que lucha para que sus hijos puedan tener lo necesario tales como: alimentación, vestuario y educación,  pues para generar sus ingresos económicos, él es  comerciante, tiene una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes, eligió esta actividad para  tener sus ingresos  semanalmente y esto lo benéfica para poder cubrir las necesidades que se le presenta, esta actividad lo viene desempeñando desde hace 8 años.
José además de la tienda  también se dedica al cultivo de maíz, ya que es una de las formas como él complementa  el sustento de la casa, para no comprar el maíz, José para implementar el nuevo cultivo para este año, está buscando un prestamo que le servirá para capital de trabajo,  lo que necesita José son  cuatro mil quetzales para poder comprar los insumos y todo lo necesario para la implementación del cultivo. José es un hombre muy sincero y cuando se compromete en algo lo cumple.
texts.en:
José is 51-year-old married man who lives with his wife and 5 children in the community of San Andrés Semetabaj.  He is a father who fights for his children so that they can have everything that they need, such as food, clothing, and education.  He makes a living by owning a store where he buys and sells groceries.  He chose this job so that he receives his salary on a weekly basis and this benefits him because he can cover the necessities that come up.  He has been doing this business for 8 years.  

Apart from running the store, José also makes a living growing corn, and it is one of the ways that he complements his income to support his household.  In order to not buy corn and to plant new corn this year, Jose is seeking out a loan that will be used as capital for his work.  He needs 4,000 quetzals to buy inputs and everything necessary for planting.  José is an honest man and when he commits to something he follows it through to completion.

loans.use: to grow corn

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en:
Normalita is 53 years old, married and manages a furniture-making business in their village. They make cabinets, sala sets and doors. 

Normalita wants to improve their output so she is asking for additional capital of PHP 8,000 to buy wood, nails and varnish used in the furniture-making business. She hopes to keep generating good income and improving the living conditions of her family,

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and varnish for use in her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Noe Arturo

texts.es: Noe de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en la agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, herbicidas, controles de plagas,  fertilizantes, etc. y ai poder seguir con su trabajo para generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Noe is 43 years old. He lives in his own home with his three children. Noe has farmed corn and sorghum for 20 years and sells his products through the buy-sell agencies for basic grains. He is able to get ahead with the money he obtains from his sales. He is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, herbicides, pest controls, fertilizers, etc. so he can continue with his work and generate better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, herbicides, pest controls, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Obidio

texts.es: Obidio de 51 años de edad se dedica desde muy joven a la agricultura (siembra maíz), gracias a la experiencia que ha tenido logra obtener una muy buena cosecha la cual comercializa en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes fijos, con las ventas que obtiene puede solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, obidio vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el está solicitando un crédito para el pago de alquiler de la parcela que muestra en la fotografía para pode seguir con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Obidio is 51 years old. From a very young age he has worked in agriculture (planting corn). Thanks to his experience he has been able to obtain a very good harvest which he sells in the nearby towns and he now has loyal customers. With the sales that he makes he can cover some of the expenses that arise from his household. Obidio lives in his own home with his wife and his daughter. He is seeking a loan to pay rent for the parcel of land that is shown in the photo so he can continue growing his crops now that they are his only source of work. This way he will be able to obtain a better quality of life together with his family.

loans.use: to pay rent for a land parcel.

loans.name: Harreta

texts.en: Harreta makes a good living with her coconut and banana farm in Aloran, in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family. Harreta has been able to support all her children through school until they graduated and secured their own jobs. Now, she wishes to plant more dwarf coconuts and bananas of a good variety so she can increase her farm's yield. However, Harreta is in need of working capital. She presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and plant dwarf coconut and banana seedlings. Harreta has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to clear and plough her land and plant dwarf coconut and banana seedlings

loans.name: Norafil

texts.en:
Norafil sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan enriched her business. She was able to buy raw ingredients and supplies that  are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will let her borrow again. She seeks an amount of 14,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, which she is using in her business. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Norafil wants to become more successful in her food business so she can expand and have her own stall. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is thankful that she was granted an 8,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is encouraged that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Rowena dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 39 years old, married, and has five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Shirly has a dried-fish vending business in the Philippines. Shirly has been in this business for four years. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Shirly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sara Esperanza

texts.es:
Sara de 56 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado en la escuela, es viuda desde hace 10 años, en esa relación tuvo tres hijos los cuales solo uno vive con ella y los demás viven en hogares aparte.


Sara se dedica a los oficios domésticos y apoya a su hijo en la siembra de maíz, esto lo hace desde que quedó viuda por lo cual decidió dedicarse a la agricultura, de modo que busca salir adelante con su esfuerzo.

Ella necesita el crédito para pagar a dos personas que le ayuden a destusar el maíz, y pagar el alquiler de una máquina que se lo desgrane, esto lo hace para guardar la cosecha y prepararla con tiempo ya que su hijo se encuentra un poco mal de salud y lo van a operar. 

Su sueño es que su hijo salga bien de la operación y seguir cultivando para que no les falte nada en la casa y esto lo lograra con la ayuda de Dios y con mucho esfuerzo
texts.en:
Sara is 56 years old. She studied until second grade in school. She has been a widow for 10 years. From this relationship she had three children among whom only one lives with her and the others live in separate homes. Sara works as a housewife and supports her son with the cultivation of corn. She has done this since she became a widow which caused her to decide to work in agriculture as a way to get ahead with her efforts. Sara needs this loan to pay for two people who will help her shuck corn and to pay rent for a machine that will shell it. They are doing this to preserve the harvest and prepare it ahead of time because her son has fallen into somewhat poor health and will be having surgery. 

Her dream is that her son will emerge healthy from the operation and to continue growing crops so that they don't go without in the house. She can accomplish this with the help of God and with a lot of strength.

loans.use: to pay two people who will help her shuck corn and to pay rent for a machine that will shell it.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita sends her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan has entrenched her business. With that loan, she was able to purchase additional grocery products to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for educational expenses for her child and pay for her family's daily needs.

Carmelita is very positive that she can further improve her business if you will lend her 16,000 Philippine pesos. This new loan will pay for additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will help her business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she will be able to sustain her family's needs.

Carmelita wants to give her children a better future someday through her hard work in business. She dreams of becoming more successful and of having financial freedom. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
Yon’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yon makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ly makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a cake maker and machine repairer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Chamroeun's Group

texts.en:
Chamroeun’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. Chamroeun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Mak's Group

texts.en:
Mak’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. Mak makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor and factory laborer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura siembra loroco, maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plaga, y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 53 years old, lives in his own home with his wife. He has made a living for 20 years from agriculture. He sows loroco, corn, and sorghum. He sells his products in the different markets that are located near his home. With what he obtains from his sales, he is able to pay some home expenses. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers, compost, herbicide, and pest control, and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph, to be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, compost, herbicide, and pest control, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Ricardo Samuel

texts.es: Ricardo de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 8 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas y asi  poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 34 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and his two children. He has made a living for 8 years from cultivating corn and beans. He sells his products in the different markets that are located near his home. With what he obtains from his sales, he is able to pay some home expenses. 

He is requesting a loan again for the purchase of fertilizers, compost, pest control, and herbicide, and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph since his sales have gone very well, and so he will be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, compost, pest control, and herbicide, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Sophanit's Group

texts.en:
Sophanit’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. She makes living cultivating rice and her fellow group-member does extra work as motor driver to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Sophanit will use her portion of this group loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help both group members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria has a coconut farm in Aloran and makes good earnings every quarter doing this type of work. This is the primary source of income for her family. 

Demetria makes it a point to prepare the land well for planting more dwarf coconut seedlings. This preparation gives her the maximum yield and generates a good income. Recently, she needed an amount to pay for "holing" the soil and planting the seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. 

Demetria wishes to sustain her business and to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for preparing the soil and planting seedlings

loans.name: Koy's Group

texts.en:
Koy’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Koy makes a living cultivating rice and does extra work as tailor and seller to support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save the time it takes to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Anarose

texts.en:
Anarose is a 33-year-old merchant from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 3.  Anarose has been in her business for more than three years now. She sells dry goods like clothes, slippers and sandals,  cosmetic products, soap and detergents and other items. 

Anarose is requesting to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like clothes, cosmetics, soap and detergents, slippers and sandals and others. In the future, Anarose has hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like clothes, cosmetics, soap and detergents, slippers and sandals and other items

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She works hard to support her family. 

She has requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase additional fish nets as well as materials for boat repair.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets as well as materials for boat repair

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo trabaja como secretario en un bufete de abogados, tienen tres hijos que viven con ella y los tres estudian, ella viven con su familia (esposo, hijos, padres y hermanos), pero solo sus hijos dependen de ella.


Maritza se ha dedicado a empleos temporales en distintos lugares. En cinco años, ha aprendido diferentes trabajos, ya que esta es la única forma que ha encontrado para trabajar y cuidar de su familia, la distancia de la casa al trabajo es de 400 metros por lo que se va caminando, y trabaja 9 horas diarias.

Con el crédito Maritza desea comprar libros, lápices, lapiceros, etc. Para poner una pequeña librería, de esta forma podrá tener un negocio donde trabajar con sus hijos y no depender de trabajos temporales.

Maritza sueña con hacer crecer el negocio, para que sus hijos tengan de donde apoyarse económicamente, ella sueña que sus hijos terminen la escuela y se gradúen de la universidad, el préstamo le ayudara a empezar a construir los sueños que tiene para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza, 40 years old, studied until high school. She is married, and her husband works as a clerk in a lawyer’s office. They have three children that live with her, and the three of them study. She lives with her family (her husband, children, parents, and siblings), but only her children depend on her.

Maritza has made a living from seasonal work in different places. In five years, she has learned different jobs, since this is the only form of work she has found to work and take care of her family. The distance from her home to work is 400 meters, which she walks, and works 9 hours a day.

With the loan, Maritza wants to purchase books, pencils, pencil cases, etc., to be able to open a small bookstore. Thus, she will be able to have a small business where she can work with her children and not depend on seasonal jobs.

Maritza dreams of making her business grow, because of which her children will have a place to support themselves economically. She dreams that her children finish school and graduate from the university. The loan will help her to begin to build those dreams that she has for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase books, pencils, pencil boxes, etc. to be able to open a small bookstore.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie works hard to support her family. Tessie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Tessie has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 48 years old and has four children.  She is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Agnes requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Agnes has been doing pig fattening for one year now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Agnes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is married and has five children. Two attend school while the others are still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers shop. She faces a  major challenge of  seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, and wheat flour . She dreams of expanding  her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, and wheat flour

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has owned a food stall business, which serves neighbours and town dwellers. Her major challenge is with fluctuations in the number of clients who buy from her, which can lead to the perishing of goods and losses in her business.

With a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a stock of goods, such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods, such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour

loans.name: Alvaro Mauricio

texts.es: Alvaro se dedica desde hace varios años al cultivo de maíz y pipián, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside y ya tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Alvaro has made a living by growing corn and squash for many years. He sells his products in the areas around where he lives and he has a lot of customers. He is able to cover some of his household expenses with his sales. He lives in a house he owns with his wife and their son. He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, insect control, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photograph to be able to continue with his work and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, insect control, etc. and to improve the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals and peanuts for resale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works hard to support her family. Teresa is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net.  Teresa has been in this business for 21 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 37 years old and married with three children.

She is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Teresita has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional rice grains to sell.

Amelita has been in this business for 34 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice grains to sell

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Aurora works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Aurora is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy rice grains to sell for her buying and selling rice grains business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Aurora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice grains to sell

loans.name: Keyla Michell

texts.es: Con tan solo 21 años de edad, Keyla es madre soltera de una niña de 7 meses. Su bebé es la razón por la que a diario lucha para lograr ser una profesional de éxito. Keyla es una dedicada y apasionada estudiante de Ingeniería industrial. Ella solicita el crédito para estudiar un curso de inglés en una prestigiosa academia de su país. Aprender inglés le ayudará a prepararse mejor porque este idioma está relacionado a su carrera, debido a que existen muchas oportunidades de trabajo que le exigirán comunicarse con extranjeros. Las metas de esta joven son culminar su carrera y trabajar arduamente para salir adelante con su pequeña niña.
texts.en: At only 21 years of age, Keyla is the single mother of a 7 month old child. Her baby is the reason she fights every day to mange to become a successful professional. Keyla is a dedicated and enthusiastic student of Industrial Engineering. She is requesting the loan to study an English course at a prestigious Academy in her country. Learning English will help her prepare better as this language is related to her major. Many of the employment opportunities that exist involve communicating with foreigners. This young woman's goal is to complete her schooling and to work hard in order to get ahead with her young daughter.

loans.use: to take an English course.

loans.name: Sonia Evelin

texts.es:
Sonia de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, ella creció con sus padres y está casada, su esposo le ayuda en la agricultura y solamente tienen un hijo.
	
Sonia se dedica a la siembra maíz y frijol junto a su esposo en una parcela que alquila, tiene varios años dedicarse a esta actividad y al comercio de productos de primera necesidad.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar una novilla que le vende un familiar la cual espera le sirva para iniciar el negocio de producción de leche y venderla en su tienda 

Su sueño es comprar un terreno para sembrar y ya no tener que alquilar.
texts.en:
Sonia, 27, studied up to 9th grade. She grew up with her parents and is married. Her husband helps her with agriculture work and they have just one son.

Sonia works sowing corn and beans with her husband in a plot of land that she rents. She has been doing this for several years, and also sells basic necessities.

This loan is needed to buy a heifer that a relative will sell to her. She hopes that with this cow she can start producing milk and selling it in her shop.

Her dream is to buy some land to grow crops so that she doesn't have to rent.

loans.use: to buy a cow from a relative.

loans.name: Jaime Ernesto

texts.es:
Jaime de 27 años de edad, creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron la agricultura y ganadería; estudió hasta bachillerato y su familia se conforma por su esposa y un hijo de tres años de edad.


Jaime  trabaja en las parcelas  que alquila durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, en la tarde ordeña las vacas para que su esposa salga a vender la leche a la comunidad.


Él solicita este crédito para comprar una yunta de bueyes para arar sus parcelas y transportar la cosecha cuando esté lista.

Su meta es comprar un vehículo con las ganancias y ofrecer servicios de transporte.
texts.en:
Jaime, 27, grew up with his parents who taught him about agriculture and livestock. He studied up to diploma level and his family is made up of his wife and his three-year-old son.

In the mornings, Jaime works plots of land that he rents, and his wife does the house work. In the afternoons he milks the cows so that his wife can go out to sell the milk to the community.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy an ox yoke to plow his land and transport the harvest when it is ready. His goal is to buy a vehicle with his earnings and offer transport services.

loans.use: to buy an ox yoke to help plough his land and transport the harvest.
